title: Pasensiya na
description:
Abstract
  
 The filmmakers believe that prostitution is, for the most part, seen in a negative light by our predominantly Catholic society. As such, people involved in the flesh trade are then shunned by society and are prejudged, not even given the chance to tell their stories first. They believe that prostitution is something that is not immortal. Forcing someone, at the threat of life or property, into prostitution is immoral, but prostitution itself is devoid of any immortality. It’s even a preference for others.
 They also believe that love is something more than the ideal notion we grew up listening to. “Love makes the world go round” and such are quotes we have grown accustomed to, hence it is ingrained in our consciousness. But love is something much more complex than that. The filmmakers believe that love will always be subject to people’s priorities in a life. It will NOT keep one alive.
 This thesis documents the product of a fifteen-minute narrative video production. Pasensya Na is a story that follows Susan, a prostitute, as she works and unwittingly searches for love in the men one happy. This story involves the harsh reality of relationships and people’s priorities in life.
 The film was short in three days in Quezon City using a mini-DV camera and halogens and PAR-38s for lighting.

title: Ang Spaceship ni Pat
description:
Abstract 
 Ang animasyong ito ay patungkol sa unti-unti nang paglaho ng mas malalim na pakitungo sa kapwa dahil sa labis nap ag-asa sa teknolohiya.
 Sinasalamin ni Pat, Pet, Pit, Pot, at Put ang negatibong epekto sa tao ng mga nagsulputang produkto na ito ng makabaghong panahon. Gaya ni pat na nahikayat maglakbay sa kalawakan kapalit ang pagkakaibigan, marami na rin sa atin ang naakit sa pagakong sa kaginhawaan at kasiyahang hatid ng direktang interaksyon natin sa isa’t isa ay kasama na ring nawawalang-kabuluhan ang mga konsepto ng ‘pagkakaibigan’ ‘pagmamahal’.

title: StillLife
description:
Abstract 
 
 The narrative thesis Gabon (Cloud tells that story of Maranao) girls who even after death, goes back to school to finish an exam. The films show the extent of the girl’s filial love, and how only through the parent’s act of letting go can the child break off from her earthly duties. 
 The 18-minute short film shot in mini-dv 24pa benefits from the marriage of the advanced digital imaging medium with the “likeness” of film movement, easily rendered in this format. Through which the filmmakers and weight into this classic tale of a ‘’ghost child’’.
 The use of silence and minimal dialogues us intentioned to highlight the gestures and visual nuances of the scenes. Music and natural sound is used to enhance the mythical and ritualistic quality of the story.
 The film aims to show the inherent power of telling stories. They serve as “reenactments”, through which we are able to exorcise aspects of childhood fears and fantasies, and become necessary inductions to one’s individuality and identity. Through the reenactment of “simply finish a task,” the ghost child in this story is able to seek love and find closure.
 For the filmmaker then, this film would have succeeded if it is not deemed only as a ghost story, but as a universal tale of love.
 In his major contribution to psychology Man and his Symbols (J.G. Ferguson Publish, 1964), Carl Jung states childhood as an “intense period of great emotional intensity, and a child’s earliest dreams often manifest in symbolic form the basic structure of the psyche, including how it will shape the destiny of the individual concerned”.
 From childhood, one reenacts this unconscious (but inherent) inheritance (and birthright) from our ancestors into his “own” rituals.
 The filmmaker aim with this thesis to further explore childhood themes earlier tackled in his student works and later professional projects: the separation and tragic reunion of a son to a guerilla father (Pula Sa Bughaw); and fisherman’s child from the Island Guimaras symbolically rebuilding his sense of home and protection in the oil-slicked mangroves (Spill); and the heartbreaking chance encounter of a prostituted woman with her long lost son, a young man seeking connection (Sarong Banggal). 
 Finally, this thesis gives the filmmaker another chance to contribute to the literature of “children in cinema”, as he was also inspired early in his filmmaking with such cinematic masterworks on children as Francois Truffaut’s Les Quatre Cent Coups (The 400 Blows) and Victtorio De Sica’s Ladri di biciclette (The Bicycle Thief).

title: Sa Pagdating ng Bawat Sandaling mga (Wala si Carmen sa list of author sa TUKLAS)
description:
Abstract
 Sa Pagdating ng Bawat Sandali ng Mga (In the Advent of Every Moment of) is a film about waiting and man’s endless search for contentment. It is an exploration of one’s definition which is beyond material possessions, status quo and accomplishments. 
 This paper is a discussion of the value of time in man’s being for everyone goes through a phase of questions and uncertainty.

title: SaPatay,saBuhay
description:
Abstract
 “CANIS FAMILIARIS” is a video documentary on how various forms of media particularly Hollywood and local celebrities have influenced the ownership of domesticated dogs and treating them as an accessory. 
 The film deals with the issue of the rise dog ownership and dogs as an accessory, as a form of a status symbols, and how it is i9nfluenced by Popular Culture based on Gramci’s definition that Popular Culture is what men and women makes from their active consumption of the texts and practices of the culture industries. Furthermore, Gramsci’s explains popular culture as how a phenomenon relates to the matters od ideology and social class.
 With the increasing demand of dog aficionados wanting to own a dog and pampering and spoiling it to the best way they can, just like what they see on TV advertisement or people and local and international celebrities, we can say that dogs as an accessory have become a form of pop culture, which, based on Neo-gramscian theory defines as a site of struggle between the forces of resistance and subordinate groups in society and force of incorporation of dominant groups in society. Because not everyone can own a specific breed of dog because of financial capability and sustainability, owning dog with high end breeds have also become a form of struggle to those who want that certain breed but can’t afford it, whereas, those who can afford it more than not, flaunt their prized possession which signifies their status in society and their wealth. 
 This video documentary is 21 minutes long and through visuals, it is how people treat their dogs either as living animals and pets, or as accessories. The video documentary also contains interviews with pet lovers, dog aficionados, pet accessories and food retailers, officer of organizations dealing with breed verification, and veterinarians. The interviewers reveal the upside and downside of caring for dogs either as pets or as mere possessions.

title: Canis Familiaris
description:
Abstract
 This film revolves around the conflict of man vs himself. 
 Kolor is story about a young adult who tries to build his own character but pressure of society and the continuous haunting of his past won’t let him do so. Marco is faced with an ironic fate. He grew up trying to get away from violence for this was his traumatic past. But he just can’t because turning to violence is the only way for him to raise his daughter. He is asked to join the gang- a job that easily generates money. Now, Marco is caught in a dilemma between living a peaceful life that he will create on his own or entering the same life his father did with risks, and at the same time, benefits.
 The film shows the struggle of man to conquer all his internal conflicts. This narrative follows the framework of the Psychoanalytic Development Theory. The formation of the personality of an individual largely depend on 1) the way he brought up, and 2) the kind of relationship he is able to build with his parents while on that stage. People with very weak personalities are most likely the ones who create internal conflicts in them. How can a young adult like Marco face this responsibilities as a father when he cannot even face his own problems as a man? What is worse is that what he’s trying to run away from is the thing that he will soon turn to violence.

title: KendiMan
description:
Abstract
 In the Philippines, really television shows are increasing in number. More and more Filipinos are getting hooked with these shows that sometimes, their personal lives are greatly affected. Most of these shows are in form of talent search and game shows. One from reality TV show that is interesting to note as well wish-giving reality shows.They have also increased in number dramatically over the years and they6 have their own following.
 Wish Ko Lang! is the pioneer wish-giving reality show in the country. Its goal is to give hope to the Filipino masses, which put their faith in good fortune, by granting their letter senders’ wishes every week. 
 Richard Rodriquez, a talent candy vendor, was featured in Wish Ko Lang!. during his episode, his unique abilities were showcased. The program provided for his family some of their needs but his ultimate wish, which the show is very well aware of, has not been granted. The program promised to call him for work as a dubbing artist.
 This documentary centered on Richard and his family. Applying the direct cinema style of filmmaking, this film showed the audience the candid realism of man’s daily life and struggles. His effort to earn money for his family’s everyday needs, along with his effort to follow up Wish Ko Lang!’s promise to him, was the main conflict in this documentary.
subject: WORKERS IN FILMS
creator: Dating, Lorena Flor Saspa
castcrew: Flores, Zenaida; Dating, Baby May; Dating, Lorena, Cardoz; Pamintuan, Kacey

title: Tutos
description:
Abstract 
 Ang Tutos ay isang kwento ng samahang pinagtibay ng panahon.
 Sastre sa isang maliit na baryo, si Rey ay isang striktong ama sa dalagang si Elena. Si Elsa naman ay nasa kolehiyo at nagnanais na maging isang mahusay na manunulat. Dahil sa kawalan ng ina sa tahanan, lumaki siyang brusko at karaniwang binansagang “astig” na madalas ikagalit ng kanyang ama. Ang kwento ng kanilang buhay ay isinasalaysay ni Boyet, ang pinakamatapat na katrabaho at kaibigan ni Rey sa tahian.
 Nagkaroon ng malalang atake sa puso si Rey na nagging dahilan upang huminto sa pag-aaral si Elsa. Sa halip na sumayaw sa kagustuhan ng ama, ginamit ni Elsa ang kaganapang ito upang makasulat ng isang obra maestro-ang kwento ng kanilang buhay.
 Upang maipakita sa manood ang ideya nais ilarawan ng pelikulang ito, ang kwento ay nakapokus sa dinamiks at kasalimuutan ng relasyon ng isang strkto at biyudong ama at “astigin” na anak na babae, batay sa pagsasalaysay sa isang kaibigan ng ama. Ipinapalagay ng manunulat na ang pagpapakita ng relasyon ng kalagatan ng mga kabaihan sa isang partriyarkal na Sistema. Samantala, ang di-pangkaraniwang personalidad ng pangunahing tauhang babae laban sa tipikal na karakter ng ama ay isang tahasang pagsalungat sa lipunang patriyakal sa postmodern na panahon.
 Ang metikuso at detalyadong paglikha ng sastre (karakter ng ama) sa isang pantalon ang ginamit na metapora ng manunulat para sa paraan ng pagpapalaki niya sa anak na babae. Ito ang nagsilbing tulay upang hubugin ang karakter ng pangunahing tauhang babae na siyang nagging representasyon ng paglihis sa mga stiryotipikong paniniwala.
 Tatlomng teorya ang ginamit upang suportahan ang mga pahayag ng Tutos. Una ang Relational Dialectics nina Leslie Baxter at Barbara Montgomery na nagpaliwanag ng iba’t-ibang masalimuot na relasyon ng mga oangunahing tauhan. Ikalawa, ang Psycholoanalytic Theory ni Sigmund Freud na nakapokus sa defense mechanism na siyang nagbibigay-kasagutan sa mga katanungang maaring nakapaloob sa personalidad ngmga taong kabilang sa mga nasabing relasyon. Ikatlo, ang Feminist Film Theory na ayon sa pagsusuri ni Adrienne Rich na nagbigay linaw at suporta sa personalidad ng pangunahing tauhan na babae.

title: Burnayan
description:
Abstract
 Burnayan is an 18-minute narrative film shot on digital video. It is about an oppressive father-and-domesticated son relationship. Burnayan presents how victimization and liberation take place in a household, a microcosm of the patriarchal society.
 The film aims to rationalize that the attainment of justice and freedom requires elimination of the roots of expression. Burnayan is a melodrama with political undertones which state that the death of the father is the death of the abusive authority. It aims to expose the relationship of the power and oppression in molding sexual, political and social identities.
subject: WORKERS IN FILMS, HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM

title: Nang Matutong Mag sapatos si Juan Dela Cruz (Nang matutong magsapatos si Juan Dela Cruz sa TUKLAS)
description:
Abstract
 Para sa isang bayan na kung saan matagal-tagal ding namuhay ang mga tao nang nakayapak, mahirap paniwalaang nakatatak ang sapatos sa pinaka-kaluluwa ng mga Pilipino. Makikita rin sa iilang nakatalang ang record ng mga Pilipino sa Guiness Book of Word Records, dalawa rito ay patungkol sa sapatos; ang isa ay para sa koleksyon ng sapatos ni Imelda Marcos at ang pangalawa naman ay ang pagkilala bilang bayan na kung saan makikita ang pinakamalaking pares ng sapatos sa mga pinagdaanang hirap ng mga Pilipino, pati ang kanilang paghanap sa kanilang pagkakakilanlan bilang isang lahi.
 Naiisip kong gawin ang dokyumentaring ito hindi lamang dahil saako ay taga-Marikina, kung hindi dahil nakita ko ang pangangailangan na ilagay sa isang awdyo-biswal na presentasyon ang kultura at kasaysayan ng isa sa pinakamahalaga at pinakamakulay na industriya sa bansa- ang industriya ng sapatos. Nawawala na kasi ang dating ningning ng industriyang ito. Nawala na ang mga hile-hilerang mga tindahan ng mga nagagandahan at mga murang mga sapatos sa 
 Marikina, Cubao at Avenida. Nawala na ang dating amoy ng bagong katad na gagawing sapatos mismo ng kabisera ng pagsasapatos ng bansa ay makikita mong lantaran ipinagbibili sa mga tiangge ang mga puslit na produktong sapatos na galing Tsina.
 Sa aking paniniwala ay kailangan ko gawin ang dokyumentaring ito, para man lang hindi tuluyang mawala at bagkus ay mapanatili ang kulturang nakakawing sa industriyang ito. Sa ganitong paraan, kahit papano’y maipapakita at maipapadama ko sa mga makakapanood nito ang halaga at lalim ng tradisyong kalakip ng bawat binibili nilang gawang local na sapatos. Ito ay hindi lamang industriyang dapat pangalagaan, ito ay kalinangang hindi dapat pabayang mawala at makalimutan.
subject: WORKERS IN FILMS
creator: Villareal, Jing
castcrew: Ubales, Edgar; Ardiente, Christian; Villareal, Andrea Claire; Plata, Bombi

title: Sa pagkupas ng himig
description:
Abstract
 
 Mia lost her mother, Elena, as the latter was rushing to Mia’s grand violin recital. The tragic and sudden passing of Elena leaves Mia and her father, Dante, in a state of unease and devastation. Elena had been their bridge because Dante and Mia were not close to each other. Dante worked abroad and his work, although it made them survive, distanced him far from his daughter. Dante, however, got sick and never worked abroad again because of health and age concerns. Dante depended on Elena physically, emotionally and financially since Elena worked as a Music professor and a performing artist. Mia depended on Elena for her inspiration and her music. She was her mentor. Elena’s abrupt death brought Mia and Dante to unbearable pain. Dante cannot accept the loss because he thinks that Mia blames him for it. If he agreed to accompany Elena to Mia’s recital, he would have saved her. Mia thinks that her father, Dante, blames her because her mother died going to her grand presentation. She leaves it at that assumption. Her father copes really hard but does not really blame her. They live in the most deafening and painful silence. Our story will show the healing time of hearts that do not want to be healed, or two persons who do not wish to be reconciled. They refuse to communicate with one another. They sleepwalking trying to cope with the death of Elena’s spirit on the other hand remains in their house, she observes her husband and daughter grieve and try cope up. She performs the usual things she did before her death and acts as if she is still alive. Her spirit it burdened and continues to stay in the house until Mia and Dante come to terms with one another and help each other heal and survive her death. The whole film shows be the healing process of Dante and Mia while they realize that Elena is really gone and they have to save each other from destruction. Dante and Mia undergo grief and depression. They try to stop their tears and feel the wreck they feel inside. They also experience denial as they still see Elena like she’s still alive. They will also feel self-pity as they see themselves help each other live and earn money. In the end, they help each other in simple ways and realize that they still have each other for a family. As Mia begins to play good music again, Dante touches her shoulder and smile at her for the first time after Elena’s death. Elena then exits the house and slowly disappears. She finds the peace she wants for her family.
subject: MUSICIANS IN FILMS
creator: Balbuena, Griska Bianca; Diaz, Cristina
castcrew: Diaz, Dory; Balbuena, Willard; Leaño, Paolo; Orendain, Pao; Clemente, Rai

title: Latak
description:
Abstract 
 Latak is the story of Ka Tinong, an embittered owner of a tapayan and sells sukang Paombong. Once a popular comics illustrator, he is now seen by his neighbors as nothing but a grumpy old man. His life changes when a kid named Gabo helps him in the nipa juice. In the end, Ka Tinong realizes how he isolated himself and through Gabo’s help he was able to rediscover his real passion.
subject: ARTISTS IN FILMS

title: Cadenza
description:
Abstract
 Ang buhay ay hindi nagtatapos sa pagkawala ng minamahal, kundi ito ay pagsubok lamang sa patuloy na pagtuklas sa misteryo ng buhay.
 Kasamang naninirahan sa isang bahay si Ester ang anak na si Jun at ang siyam na taong gulang na apong si Charmaine. Isang buwan na ang nakalipas mula ng pumanaw si Ruben, ang asawa ni Ester. Dahil sa nangyari, nabalot ng kalungkutan at pagluluksa si Ester. Palagi niyang naiisip ang masayang alaala nila ng asawa. Madalas siyang mapag-isa at tulala. Ang pelikulang Cadenza ay kuwento ng pagtanggap sa realidad, pagbangon mula sa pagkakalugmok at patuloy na pagtuklas sa paglalakbay sa buhay.
subject: Mourning in films
creator: Ngitngit, Kriselda; Sanchez, Rowena
castcrew: Ngitngit, Bobby; Olympia, Adrian; Balajadia, Doty; Valencia, Vanessa; Tarog, Jerrold

title: Freshmanite
description:
Abstract
 Telling a story through a computer program.
 Stories have been told through many mediums. Speech, book, theatre, music, artwork, and movies all have share of great stories to tell.
 What about computer? A device more commonly associated with word processors and other menial office jobs than with stories.
 As one of the most influence new technologies of the 20th century, the computer and the Internet set themselves apart from previous information technologies by being interactive; the person by communicating with device can actively gain the information he needs or wants.
 A story is also information.
 This production thesis attempts to emulate the experience of learning a story through a computer program.
subject: STUDENTS IN FILMS
creator: Elegado, Jose Melchor
castcrew: Garcia, Iohann, Melchor, Jose Elegado

title: Halaw
description:
Abstract
 Title: “HALAW” (“Rooted”/ ”Adopted”) narrative- experience film
 Name: Cher Pauline and Patrick Ace Bright
 TRT:9 mins.
 Language: Filipino and English subtitles
 Shooting/ Original Format: Digital Video
 
 This narrative film is a journey inside Norman’s imagination and creative motivations. Norman is a struggling artist who is stretched into opposite directions by his true passion and the graphic novel word showcasing “living” his different states of mind in succession with his dream graphic novel.
 “Belief strengthens truth” is the central theme of his film. This film supports Gilles Deleuze’s idea of “Cinema of the seer and no longer the agent.” Coinciding with the main character’s decision-making, this film also elicits active participation from the audience. The viewer is given the chance to believe in what the actual story and time-frame of the film is. Nevertheless, the film still highlights the distinction between its objectively in relation to its audience and its subjectivity to the main character as it is treated just like a brief peek inside Norman’s mind. This, therefore, gives respect due to each and everyone’s truth-fictional or not.
subject: ARTISTS IN FILMS
creator: Cruz, Cher Pauline; Bright, Patrick Ace

title: LualKulambo (Lual Kulambu sa Tuklas at sa film)
description:
Abstract
 Lual Kulambo is about going beyond or breaking from one’s comfort zones. The film is based on the theory of post-colonialism, leading towards the studies on urbanization and city studies. It centers on the discussion on the point of view of the colonized people who reject the idea of colonialization and modification of one’s culture. This film is a microcosm of these concepts. Tomas, having been raised the traditional, Filipino way bi his Lola, explores and eventually takes on the challenging of living in the city and accepts the new ways of life that comes with it.

description: Shirley was curious about the story of missing people in their place so she conducted research about it. She was convinced that people from the mountains were killing those civilians only to find out that the military was the one who was doing such violence. [Supplied by Quad]

castcrew: Cardoz, Samuel; Cardoz, Catherine; Cardoz, Elizabeth; Arumpac, Adjani

title: Mistulang tuwid
description:
Abstract
 Our film centers on the inner psychological and psychical struggles of young woman battling through with a dilemma that pits the external societal expectations of her sexuality against her real self. 
 
 In a situation where a person’s right to freedom of choice in life is subjected under complete manipulation by the pre-mediated events surrounding the circumstances that bind her, we witness how a conscious feministic mind create a solution for her own sake to the best of her future interest and strength of person will. 
 The realization that each human being as the only rightful captain of one’s soul and destiny leads us to believe in the empowerment of a person’s honest decision. Although a certain “sacrifice” entailing another potential life is essential perpetuated within this specific journey, which may yield to be inevitably regrettable or otherwise, it become evident that the price of freedom for one soul may come at a costly state of moral abandon.
subject: NURSES IN FILMS

title: Yung Orbe (Yung orbe! sa TUKLAS)
description:
Abstract
 I have always loved watching animated films and TV series since I was a little kid. I was also keen on catching behind-the-scene programs on TV showing how animators draw by hand each character’s movement frame-by-frame. I wasn’t gifted with hands good in drawing but I surely wanted to dip them in something closely related to craft. Fortunately computer animation came and drawing the characters frame by frame isn’t necessary anymore. It has been my dream to produce & direct an animation film and thankfully I had been able to it with my thesis.
 “Young Obre!” is a light take on the universal theme of power and how it can make individuals corrupt and greedy. I wanted to present it in this way because the trend nowadays is that people talk about power and corruption in a loud manner. However, their message tends to be carried away in the noise. “ Young Obre!” gets the notice of the viewers because of its humor and lightness but in the end they feel there’s something subversive underneath its surface.
subject: MYTHS AND THE CINEMA
creator: Sarabia, Paul David Factor
castcrew: Sarabia, Paul David F.

title: Blue Collar
description:
Abstract 
 Blue Collar is a documentary about issues of contractual employment in the Philippines. It aims to show what employees think about and how they deal with strict and sometimes unfair hiring and employment practices of certain employers or companies.
 Malls, fast food chains, and hospitals may have dealt with their problems with human error by making use of non-human technology or what we usually call mechanical robot machinery. But the fact remains that they still employ humans to do some work that machines still cannot perform on its own. Surely not all of these companies and institutions treat their laborers as badly as the others in the name of profit but it is a fact that even the largest single owner of real estate in the world does contractual employment. 
 The problem with contractual employment is that people who want to be employed right away have no other choice but to agree with the employer’s set of conditions. Conditions such as being a college graduate or in college level just to do service crew work for fast food.
subject: SOCIETY IN FILMS
creator: Doloiras, China
castcrew: Doloiras, China

title: An Paragbunak (An paragbunak sa Tuklas at sa film)
description:
Abstract
 The documentary is about a woman who is trying to raise her family and give them a decent life by being a laundrywoman.
 Aling Juanita was influenced mainly by her father not to pursue studies anymore and instead strive hard to raise a family of five and reach her aspirations life through her children. Her life is a reflection of a woman who went out of her way to fill in her husband’s shortcoming and make sure that her children will be able to have the education that she herself was not able to attain.
 It presents the issue of who is responsible in molding one’s future by overcoming hindrances and influences pushed by society. This documentary gives the audience an idea about the day to day life of a simple woman and her drive to make her family obtain the success in life which she has never achieved. This documentary also presents a new brand of feminism that is practical, survivalist, and revolving around strict patriarchal structures that bind them in stereotyped roles

title: Manwal sa Paggawan g Pelikula
description:
Abstract
 The necessity of resistance is the motivation behind the making of Manwal sa Paggawa ng Pelikula. Done in the format of a metafilm, Manwal highlights dissatisfaction as a prerequisite to change, wheter within the cultural sphere, as in filmmaking, or within the political structures of current society 
 
 Manwal is the story of Orly, a young filmmaker who is determined to realize his pet project: a digital remake of Ishmael Bernal’s classic Himala. His film concept is poorly received by his peers and professor, yet a strange encounter with a divine boat drives him to persist in his goal. Himala 2007’s starts include has-been actors Gay Paradise and Jule Madigan, both desperate for a showbiz comeback. Orly’s production is riddled with disaster; even Himala 2007’s premiere night is horrific flop. Still Orly emegres happy with his work. The audience, however- most of them his own crew members-are not as satisfied.
 
 Dissatisfaction, as emphasized in the conclusion, is central to the film since it highlights the necessity for change, whether within the cultural sphere, as in filmmaking, or in the political structures of current society. Disillusionment is a desire for change, and change cannot be achieved without a certain level of hostility. The reflexive gesture of Manwal’s interrogation of filmmaking is thus necessarily antagonistic, in the same way that any movement which seeks to oppose dominant structures will necessary produce conflict.
 
 The resolution of such conflict, however, canot be fulfilled within any film’s narrative. It can only be realized within the realm of concreate and political action. This argument constitutes the basis for the film’s satirical and reflexive Brechtian aesthetics, as well as its open-ended narrative style.

title: Parada (Fernandez, Patrizia Inez Lozada ang author sa TUKLAS)
description:
Abstract 
 High School is as integral part of our lives for it is here that one’s personality is molded. It is here, where one creates memories that he shall carry forever. But for someone who lives by the rules. High School can be only as a routine, thus stimulating that feeling of boredom.
 Boredom is very common to High School students in exclusive Catholic schools. Rules and uniformity are essential in such schools, and as a result, students tend to lack self-expression and self-identity. At this certain age, when one is in high school, a student has very limited ways and means meeting and socializing with other people other than with those school.
 When one bored, time seem longer but events seem to pass at much quicker pace. This normally occurs when one lives a routinely life. All these feelings are reflected and portrayed in the video installation, Parada.

title: Bihag (Alparce, Sierra Cecilia Coronacion ang author sa TUKLAS)
description:
Abstract
 
 The film is about Istong Peñamante, a 68-year old grandfather, who finds himself in the same situation he was in more than two decades ago, 26 years after his brother’s abduction, his granddaughter who is an activist writer is abducted, becoming a victim of involuntary disappearance as well. The lives of the family members are interrupted and their strong bond is put to the test. For the second time, Istong is torn between two choices, to give in to hopelessness, or to continue fighting for his loved ones, and for himself.
 
 Probably one of the best gifts that we human have received from God is our freedom to choose. Yes, choices are powerful weapons and how we used it to our advantage or disadvantage is up to us. It can lead us to freedom or slavery, to victory or to default. In every situation that we are in, there will always be a saving grace for us, it is just a matter of choice in what to believe in, whom to believe in, and how to look at things in perspective. We are made up of a thousand choices in our live, and through our decisions, our character is reflected.

title: Diko
description:
Abstract
 Si Ryan ay isang binatilyo, nasa 20 anyos, na nagkaroon ng isang di-inaasahang karanasan sa buhay dalawang taon na ang nakalipas. Mula sa isang bar sa lungsod ay ikukuwento niya sa ating mga manonood ang tungkol sa kanyang pambihirang karanasan, at ang babaeng kinahumalingan niya, si Cathy, at ng kanyang kuya na si Robert.
 Ang ating mga nalaman tungkol sa ating paligid, pamilya, pagkakakilala sa sarili at ibang tao, kultura, at marami pang iba, ay bunga ng ating pakikisalamuha o socialization simula noong bata pa hangang magkaroon ng sariling pag-iisip. Mula rito ay nabubuo ang konsepto natin ng “self.” 
 Papano kung malalaman ni Ryan na kinagisnan niyang relasyon kay Robert ay nababalot ng kasinungalingan? 
 Sa loob ng tatlumpong minute ay ilalahad ng DIKO ang ideya na maaring hindi lahat ng ating nalalaman, lalo na tungkol sa ating sarili, ay tama at totoo.

title: Kaliwaan
description:
Abstract 
 Human relationships are as complex as life itself. This is what the filmmaker explored in his production thesis entitled Kaliwaan. Having been exposed to all sorts of human interaction in his work, family and personal life, the filmmaker never stopped investigating the intricacies of human relationships. And interestingly, there are no two relationships that are alike. 
 Zooming in on the study of relationships between husband and wife, the film shows how love can escape the boundaries of time, space and reality. Faithfulness to your partner is an important ingredient in a relationship because it is the mother of trust, conviction and staying true to each other's expectations. But when faithfulness becomes an intangible concept, where does one draw the line? When is it time to move on and when is it worthy to keep holding on? What does being a man entail in a relationship? What is a woman's place in a relationship? 
 The result is an ambitious and daring account of an unusual affair that transpired for five days between two strangers. The story begins on a normal Monday and ends with an unexpected twist come Friday. What seems to be just another week at the office turns out to be a life-changing experience. If one week is all you have to fix what is broken, how do you even start? 
 The film is more of a memory than an ordinary turning of events. A woman with no past meets a man who needs to build his future. Together they form their own virtual bubble called the present.

title: Pagkagising (Ang Pagkagising sa Tuklas)
description:
Abstract 
 Ang Pagkagising is the story of woman as interpreted by the individuation theory of Carl Jung. Using universal symbols and archetypes, it tells the story of her creation, demise and present condition. The central character, Eve, awakens only after her Barbie archetype, Babae, frees herself from the cultural constraints she finds herself in. This is spurred by the growing discontent of the animus, remembering that she is made in the image of God and knowing that her subjugation is caused only by the fear of man. 
 The story fluctuates from video and animation as well as from planes of symbolic consciousness. Its form aims to recreate the fluidity of the feminine. 
 Myths and stories have been passed on from generation to generation, but some, like the Bible's story of creation, have shown women in an unequal and negative light. Creation stories are important because it tells us our origin and this affects how we perceive ourselves. This movie is based on the Bible but interpreted by new scientific findings that tell us the important role women played in the creation of humanity.

title: Yes no cat dog
description:
Abstract 
 
 The film Yes No Cat Dog is a criticism on the current state of mind by the Filipino people that by conforming to everything that is foreign, we shall find our way to progression. The filmmaker wants to make a statement that we can progress as a nation by simply giving importance to everything that we have starting from language. Language is a very important part of a country's identity. A country without a language, cannot have an identity for language is a very big part of culture. So many cultures had been imposed on the Philippines since it had been colonized by several countries. The sad thing about it is that the Filipino people accept these cultures that are killing the culture that this nation once had. The film wants to tell the people that the country can be better and is better without these imposed language and culture. The filmmaker wants to remind the people that giving value to language and culture is something that the people of this country should never forget. If a country has a strong identity, this is something that can never be stolen from them and it will make the country stable for always.

title: One hundred Percent 100%
description:
Abstract 
 Abesamis, G.M. (2008). One Hundred Percent, Student Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication. 
 One Hundred Percent is about a man in search for ultimate happiness. Ricky Torres, the protagonist, is a 50-year old rich, successful, intelligent, family-oriented, and good-looking businessman. He has a special power - he can see numbers on top of people (including himself), numbers which he assumes to be a numerical representation of happiness and success. This ability made him methodical and structured, following cues as to what activities, possessions, relationships, and other life aspects would make his number go up. What he realizes though, when he attends his father's wake, is that death is the last thing he has to accomplish to obtain his ultimate goal. At a time when he is so close to getting one-hundred percent, he struggles as to whether or not he would believe in death as the way to achieve ultimate happiness. 
 The film is a comment on how dominant ideologies dictate to society what happiness should be - western culture, material wealth, heterosexual romance, a loving family, etc. The number represents social norms we blindly and unconsciously follow, rules and standards which lead us to believing in specific concepts of ultimate satisfaction and fulfillment. The thesis used Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs and Plato's Theory of Forms as the main theories in the framework
subject: HEALTH EDUCATION FILMS
creator: Abesamis, Gersom M.
castcrew: Baco, King Mark; Gonzales, Kariza; Tang, Thesa; Magno, Sandino; Yamsuan, Louse Anne

title: Sukad Ni adto Ginatawag siya ugBabaye
description:
Abstract
 
 
 In an environment where being is considered as a significant female characteristic, the woman cannot help but long for the ideal doll-like form. She engages in various diet strategies and exercise routines to tone her curves. She submit to unnecessary cosmetic surgeries in order to achieve the kind of appearance she feels her body should have. She likewise tries to keep up with the latest trends to show off her assets and hide her imperfection.
 
 Factors such as these shape the woman’s superficial notion of beauty. As opposed to the popular tagalog folkore “Si Malakas at si Maganda” (Strong and Beauty), this film takes in to account the visayan creation story “Si Sikalak ug si Sikabay” (Man and Woman ) where there is no designation of gender characteristics. Hence, Sukad Niadto Ginatawag Siya Ug Babaye (From that Time On, She Has Been Called Woman) came into being.
subject: WOMEN IN FILMS
creator: Lapus, Ana Patricia
castcrew: Varela, Nicholas; Linapan, Chriistian; Manalastas, Michael; Guillermo, Jopay; Varela, Nicholas

title: Big Bro (wala si Vitor sa list of authors sa TUKLAS)
description:
Abstract
 
 Big Bro is a short narrative film about two brothers and the strains that happen in their relationship, after their single-mother's demise and as they eventually find conflicting roles in society-the big brother as a policeman, tasked to protect the peace and order of the prevailing status quo and the younger brother as a student activist, urged to challenge the prevailing social order.
 
 It is also a take at the current situation of Philippine society under President Gloria Arroyo, often accused as an oppressive regime and of using various forms of political repression in order to maintain its desired status quo.
subject: POLITICAL FILMS
creator: De la Vega, James P.; Villanueva, Vitor Lorenzo L.
castcrew: Tayag, Preciouse Ann; Acuin, Paula Victoria; Alarilla, Adrian Ellis; Castro, Marella Jem; Alparce, Sierra Cecilia

title: Quad
description:
Abstract
 
 The panopticon was never built. Yet, its principles have found a locus within the social institutions of a disciplinary society. Social institutions employ various panoptic mechanisms to individuals for the purpose of control, regulation, maintenance of order, and security.
 
 However, these panoptic mechanisms, although ideally perceived to grant services for the welfare, have several hidden implications that may pull individuals back to subordination and enslavement. Individuals suffer from the experience of being watched. Panoptic mechanisms today such as the surveillance systems have the capacity to curtail the individual's privacy, and subject one to criminal associations driven by biases on ethnicity and sexuality. The whole society becomes one gigantic panopticon rendering the individuals as new prisoners even within their most intimate and personal spaces.
subject: SOCIETY IN FILMS
creator: Razon, Gino
castcrew: Villota, Alleson; Tenorio, Regine Amor; Balicas, Rommel and Lloyd; Molina; Karl Benson

title: Hulagpos
description:
Abstract
 
 Hulagpos tells the story of a ten-year-old girl named Angeli who has a stern, cold and seemingly unfeeling mother named Maria. To prevent Angeli from going inside a forbidden room, Maria tells her daughter that a child-eating monster resides in there. Fully believing what her mother told her, Angeli refuses to go inside the room until a prank leads her to believe that the monster got her friend. Going inside the room, Angeli discovers her mother's secret. It is a fetus conceived thru her mother's forbidden love affair, hidden inside the hollow statue of the Virgin Mary.

title: Equations
description:
Abstract 
 I wanted to explore the social and psychological problems that closeted teenage gays have, and the issue of coming out for them. Hopefully, those who see the film will become more open minded about young gays and homosexuals in the country, and see that all relationships, whether same sex or not, are all equal.
  Problem:
  "Coming out" for the young teenage gay is still a horrendous process here in our country. We strive to change the taboo image of homosexuality to be able to give it a more liberated rein, and hopefully reduce some of the fear of the closeted gay teen in coming out.
 Approach: 
 Equations is a film that approaches homosexuality in a sense that makes it something that is not out of the ordinary gender-wise, but extraordinary because of the relationships; an intelligent young man, Vincent, defies the stereotypes of the homosexuality in the Philippines; the bakla. He does not cross dress, he does not act effeminately, and he's not loud. He is shown as just an ordinary human being yearning for love and finding out that it starts first by knowing, accepting and loving himself.
 Results: 
 This film and this study will hopefully provide a wider and more open-minded view in homosexuality, like that started by the ground- breaking film Ang Pagdadalaga ni Maximo Oliveros. 
 Conclusion: 
 Viewers of this film will go home more informed at the diversity of gay culture, and not just brand homosexuals in the terms of bakla or female-wannabes. In truth, they are human beings as well, same as the regular heterosexual male or female; they are just different in expressing the ways they love, as heterosexuals are different from them. And the stage of youth provides that atmosphere of experimentation, and generally, it is when a lot of gays find out and begin to accept who they are.
subject: GENDER AND THE CINEMA

title: Pangungusap ng Sandali (Ocampo, Regine Edessa De Guzman ang name ng author sa TUKLAS)
description:
Abstract
  Pangungusap ng Sandali is a film about a young seamstress in the 1950's waiting for her soldier-husband's letter. The protagonist is trapped in their house and in the cycle of waiting. She talks with a living statue of the Resurrected Christ who questions and mocks her at the same time. When the mailman delivers the letter, she merely glances at it and does not open it. In the end she goes back to sewing in the sewing room, and the cycle of waiting starts again. I will be using the theory of Psychoanalysis in Lacanian terms and the construction of subject in relation to space and time. This is to say that the protagonist is constructing a sense of self-identity in relation to the house and to the relationships she has in her life. The treatment of the film would be anchored on magic realism which is characterized by two conflicting realities, one as the story is set on a rational view but at the same time accepting the supernatural as mundane reality.

title: Sa aking mga Kababata Isang Makabagong Kath ang Ikatlong Mumdong Kalungkutan (Sa Aking mga kababata, isang makabagong katha ng ikatlong mundong kalungkutan sa TUKLAS))
description:
Abstract
 
 The commercial and economic viability of cities are reason enough for people to leave their provinces and settle here. Although frequently the outcome of this action leans more on the negative, considering endless stories of human trafficking, child abuse, and other forms of maltreatment that are very much common in urban areas, people still continue to stay in cities, despite its shortcomings. There may be other reasons after all.
 
 The atmosphere it provides to its people is essentially a point of comparison, as it is already common knowledge that fast-paced living in cities represents the good things in life the luxury of convenience, the social lifestyle, and, more importantly, the achievement of dreams. Just by keen observation, one can generally attest to this: Modern living is ideal, but deeply isolating.
 
 Imagine a jam-packed coliseum wherein everyone sits to watch a concert. No one knows anyone except those people in groups, but everyone is sure enough to stay. Apparently, the audience is not united by personal familiarity; what unites them is the concert itself -- the spectacle- -the idea that brings them in one place. That's how cities work. We don't know each other but we interact. We are propelled by common threads,
 
 but we work separately, we feel separately, and we cry separately. In the long run, it is not impossible to see a city void of human sound, people have pods plugged into their ears and verbal communication isn't at all necessary because PDAs are perfect enough to mediate, and all that remains are urban noises. This film explores the transition from the unified world to the atomized society, and how the richness of the urban mind morphs into a dull reflex of mechanical existence. Like an empty shell lying on the seashore, sadly, the modern man is alone.
subject: HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM

title: Silang may Salah (those with prayers) (Silang may salah ang nasa TUKLAS)
description:
Abstract
 
 The story has been waiting a long time to be told.
 The documentary is an advocacy for women who do not have the faculty or even the access and freedom to tell their stories. It is unfolding of the past and a visual narrative of the present lives of four women in Quezon City Female dorm. It tells how the women ended up in jail. It seeks to expose the maligned practice of law enforcers in haphazardly arresting Muslim women and pocketing the ‘bail money’ from their relatives. It take a look at the women’s living conditions inside jail as well as the progress (or the lack of it) in their cases.
 A series of interview with the four women reviled the different life situations they were in at the time of their arrest. One was working for her family and studying at the same time, one was a housewife, one had a baby, and one was a minor, only 15 years old when she was arrested. The story is an unfortunate metaphor of the bigger picture of our society’s discrimination against Muslim as well as this continuing opportunities against women.
subject: PRISON FILMS
creator: Arumpac, Alyx Ayn
castcrew: Arumpac, Adjani Guerrero; Lacaniloa, Noah; Hernandez, Otto

title: Hilom
description:
Abstract 
 The pain Peping felt during the accident was nothing compared to the harsh reality that confronted him when he recovered from his injuries. The power he once had, as well as his relationship with his family, was slowly deteriorating. 
 He woke up to a different life that he tried to disguise as the one he used to live. The more he pursued for it to remain the same, the more distant he became to his wife and son. He was consumed by bitterness and regret that he forgot to mend the relationships that were on the verge of breaking apart. 
 Peping never appreciated his family until they were gone. He realized that he needed to change. He needed to accept his situation. He needed to live in silence.
subject: LOVE IN FILMS

title: Isang Juan
description:
Abstract
 
 
 This thesis deals with the Filipino trait bayanihan or togetherness in common effort.
 In old times, where kubo or the Philippine traditional huts are carried or built by a group of people. It one a sense of identity as he/she is assigned to a role.
 
 Inevitably modernity and technology advancements are introduce to the society. And there are activities now that people can do by themselves with the help of modern day science having up-to-date gadgets and computers. Consequently person involved in group work may loss the opportunity to interact with the others as tasks become reassigned.
 
 Together with this. Western culture become more prominent promoting individualism and isolation, one that completely opposes Philippine culture that believe in unity 
 
 Eventually the idea of social interaction is viewed as a hindrance to personal growth. But in fact the value of social interaction gives each one an overview of the society that they live in thus helping one to find their own identity.
 
 The thesis hopes to make the people understand the more the Filipino trait of bayanihan removing any negative perspective toward this value. It’s not a mare conformance to a group’s ideologies but a way to find oneself through interaction, seeing their own as an equal to those they work with, giving them equal chances to find themselves and become better

title: Sandao (Senile)
description:
Abstract
 
 After the 1995 alleged rub-out of the Kalasag Gang - a notorious Mindanao mafia operating in Manila, Abel decided to go back to Misamis Occidental, the birthplace of Kalasag gang, to live a simple life by coconut farming. However, despite his struggle to change and to provide his son an education, things in the community get worse. A coconut processing plant is going to be closed and petty crimes like stealing livestocks become rampant. This film aims to get a closer look on the life of a man situated in a milieu where political and economic repression is inevitable: where capitalism made the masses poor; globalization made them poorer; and individualism chained them to remain poor. The character of Abel is an individualist who cries for change, not for the common good but only for himself. But that kind of change can never be realized without thinking beyond one's personal ambitions.

title: Metronome
description:
Abstract 
 Metronome is about an individual who is confined within a defined social system, one of constant monotony and routine that dictates to the story's protagonist. This social system dictates to him how he should go about his everyday life, from his life at home to his workplace and defines his limitations inside a prescribed set of norms. 
 In the film, the lead character will be situated in a world that epitomizes the complete opposite of what can be perceived as his "natural" environment. This sudden shift from one social sphere to another is coined as a shock, as defined in the theory of Social Construction of Reality (Berger & Luckman, 1996). This "shock puts the individual in a situation wherein he is suddenly confronted with a choice whether to go back to the previous environment where he is already accustomed to or risk staying in a new unfamiliar environment which presents uncertainty but, at the same time, has the potential to be more beneficial than the previous social sphere. To highlight the disparity of the two social environments, the filmmaker used music. Both worlds are constrained by music, specifically a tempo identified in the music used in the film. In the first world, everybody around the film's protagonist had to follow the same downbeat in the identified tempo. In the second world however, the people surrounding the film's protagonist learned how to work around this tempo, creating percussive music created by the normal found objects that can be described as imaginative, since it does not follow the same downbeat as the first world. The characters in the second world make full of use of the tempo and attack it with fervor, striking their beats in whatever window of opportunity that presents itself. 
 In the first part, the percussive music is monotonous and repetitive. In the second part, however, the music that is created is dynamic and plays around with its prescribed environment.
subject: SOCIETY IN FILMS
creator: Magno, Sandino F.
castcrew: Garcia, Sol; Ricio, Digo; Abesamis, Gerson M.; Locsin, Mark; Idanan, Ice

title: Pundok (Pundok (army) sa TUKLAS)
description:
Abstract
 
 Ang organisasyong moncadista sa saulon. Cebo ay isang alternatibong hukbo na nagsasabuhay ng “moral military training”. Ito ay isang pagsasanay na kinapalooban ng pagbabawal sa mga bisyo, pagiging vegetarian, at pagpapahabang buhok at bigote ng mga kalalakihan. Sa dokumentaryong ito, susuriin ang historical at kultural na aspeto ng organisasyon kasabay ng pagsipat sa kanilang pagdiriwang ng foundation day. Kon ganon ang dokumentaryong “Pundok”ay pumupukol sa alternatibong konstekto ng military naka-angkla sa kaugaliang banal. Mala opirasyong Militar ang estilo ng pelikula upang magpatibay ang pagiging alternatibong nito kumpara sa mas popular at mas marahas na konsepto ng militarism. Gayundin estilong etnograpiko ang istractura nito upang ang pagsipat sa kanilang kultura ay hindi lamang manatili sa antas ng karaniwang kyuryusidad. Sa ganitong pamamaraan ay mas mailalbas ang natural na tekstura ng kanilang pamumuhay at saloobin, na patuloy na nagsusumikap para magkaroon ng espasyo sa mundo ng mainstream o popular na kultura kahit pa mayroong mga pulitikal at kultural na balakid.
subject: SOCIETY IN FILMS
creator: Tan, Kerchlynn C.; Valencia, Vanessa E.

title: Slideshow
description:
Abstract
 
 The film is about finding about connection between food and life process. It is composed of five vignettes illustrating the progressive flow of food and life stage through photographs.
 
 The film’s form aims to mimic how the mind remember and highlights certain event in life , that is through still Image and fragments of memory. Presented as a slideshow with accompanying music, voice to create the sequential narrative and fill in the spaces in-between photographs.
 
 Another premise of the film is the idea that life and food stages are similar and intertwined with each other. The chapter are divided into stages, each representing a stage in both the food process and the life process. The categorization and division of the chapters are roughly based on Erik Erikson’s stage of psychosocial development and common post- harvest food production stage.

title: Sayaw Tayo (kahit Walang Musika)
description:
Abstract
 
 Cruz, F. X. B. (2009). Sayaw Tayo (Kahit Walang Musika). Unpublished undergraduate thesis. Diliman, Quezon City: University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 The thesis film, "Sayaw Tayo (Kahit Walang Musika)," is an optimistic rendering of the idea of love as work. It serves as love letter and as an attempt to recreate dance with images. The thesis unites ideas about love and relationship, traditional symbolism, nonverbal communication, and color in film. It abides by the lyrical film tradition, in which the camera is infused with the consciousness of the filmmaker and behaves according to how the filmmaker sees and reacts to the visions, and applies Patti Bellantoni's study of color in narrative film, which is based on the idea that color can affect a person's thoughts or emotions. The thesis film employs computer-generated camerawork and visual effects and is an intimate production.
creator: Cruz, Francis Xavier B.
castcrew: Cruz, Francis Xavier B.; Lagdameo, Joyce Kathleen;

title: Ikot
description:
Abstract
 Ang dookyumentaryo ay umiikot sa buhay ni Benjamin Legazpi, isang 35-taong gulang na tricycle driver at mula sa Brgy.san Roque, Quezon City (isang depressed na komunidad), kung saan pinapakita ang kanyang araw-araw na pakikipagsapalaran at ang kayang pagpupunyagi para masuportahan ang sarili at ang kanyang pamilya. Ito ang kuwento ng kanyang pagharap sa problema ng mga namamasada ng tricycle sa kanilang komunidad, at kung paano hinahanarap ng kanyang pamilya ang kaligayan ng kanyang bunsong anak na may cerebral palsy. Sa pagsisikap nya, pilit niyang kinkamit ang mga pangarap niya na hindi lamang para sa sarili at pamilya kundi pati narin sa mga residente ng kanyang komunidad at sa kaunlaran ng karamihan.
 
 Saigan ng dokumentaryo ang Theory of History Materialism ni Karl Marx isang sistematikong pagsusuri ng lipunan, kung saan ang pag-unlad ng lipunan ay produkto ng mga kontradiksyon ng dalawang puwersang salik sa ekonomiya para sa pagkamit ng kapangyarihan sa moda ng produksyon. Sinasabing ang kolektibong pagsalungat sa mga naghaharing uri ang solusyon sa mga panlipunang krisis na nag-uugat sa kasalukuyang sistema ng lipunan. (Craib,1997) Kaakibat rin ang sanaysay ni Jhon Fiske na British Cultural Studies na nagsasabing kahit pa nabuo ang midya mula sa kapitalistang institusyon ay maari itong makapagbigay ng boses sa mga inaaping uri at magsilbing paraan sa pagtanggal sa Sistema ng lipunan.(Allen,1992)
subject: WORKERS IN FILMS
creator: Mailed, Ann Michelle V.
castcrew: Mailed, Ann Michekke V.

title: Araw ng Pighati
description:
Abstract 
 Abeledo,R.B.(2009). Araw ng Pighati, Student Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 Araw ng Pighati aims to understand the underlying reason behind the emotions experienced during the mourning for the dead. Pacific Dimaantal/Pico is an undertaker in his fifties, placing his dreams and prospect of a better life in the hands of his kind and loving son, Victor Dimaantal/Pico. Living alongside the cemetery, Pico has hoped to alleviate his current condition by way of his son’s education. He believes that by having his son graduate all the way through college would he finally be able to improve his own life- imposing his own preferences over his son’s personal choice. With the apparent death of his son’s caused by an accident, Pico is left to fend for himself, with his hopes and dreams defeated. At his son’s funeral, the main argument of the film is tapped-What is he really grieving for? The death of his son? Or the death of his dream? 
 
 The film attempts to portrays death in two aspects-literal and figurative. Literal being Toto’s physical death, and figurative being the death of both father and son’s individual dreams. The film is also a comment on funeral practices, the directly observable customs and traditions witnessed during funerals, and how death and grieving are valued in the Philippines context through the dialogues and commentaries expressed, by the ghost characters in the film.
 The thesis used the Structuralist Film Theory as a definitive frameworks in its storytelling by using codes and conventions in constructing varied forms meaning
subject: HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM
creator: Abeledo, Ryanorlie B.
castcrew: Abeledo, Diana; Mallari, Rivelle

title: CafeSanctuario
description:
Abstract 
 Café Sanctuario deals with the issue of acceptance and of the coming into terms with conflicts that hunts us from our past, set against a spectacular depiction of purgatory. It is a story of how a person undergoes the process of purification for him to be ready to reach his final destination.
  
 Miguel, 55-year old man, is about to propose to his 22-year old girlfriend. On his way to Café Sanctuario, the coffee shop where he is about to meet his girlfriend, he rides a train and was surprised to find the same coffee shop inside it. Simoun, the manager of Café Sanctuario, approaches him and starts talking to him. In the middle of their conversation, Miguel sees his sister Isabel who passed away during the war. Miguel tries to run after Isabel as she lights the train but doesn’t make it in time for the doors that are already closing. Simoun starts to explain to Miguel that he still needs to reveals Miguel’s inner conflicts forcing him to ideal with his past in order for Miguel to finally arrive at his destination. 
 The framework used in our film makes use of the concepts of Speculative Fiction and Jacques Derrida’s Hauntology.
subject: GHOSTS IN FILMS
creator: Aspiras, Sue & Greg Sabado
castcrew:
Aspiras, Sue; Sabado, Greg; Alcazen, Whammy;
Seeckts, Sheen Irerick; Cabigon, Chad Angelik

title: Padalang Tinig
description:
Abstract
 Castillo,N.A. (2009). Padalang Tinig , Student Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 The film is about the sacrifice pf an eldest daughter in order to fulfill her responsibilities to her family. Lourdes sacrificed her own goals in order to take care and to send her younger sister, Lima to school.
 Now Lourdes feel upset. Upset, because she feels that she cannot carry out her goals anymore. She feels that she cannot get out of that cycle of responsibilities vested on her. Because Lima decided to support her child, Margaret by leaving the country, while leaving her daughter with Lourdes.
 Lourdes accepted the responsibility of taking care of Margaret; but she is very aloof and strict with the child. But despite the strictness, Margaret felt it is “love.”
 On the other hand, Lima didn’t forget to send her Ate voice tapes an PX goods for her small business. However, Lourdes didn’t answer any of her voice tapes.
 Towards the end story, Lourdes would start to realize through the child how important and loved she is. In the end, Lourdes would decide to record a voice tape to Liam. This would be the start of the star of her acceptance of her situation she is in.
creator: Castillo, Nicolle Ann L.
castcrew: Palomares, Sasha; Araneta, Miko; Ferrer, Jeminah Ruth; Vardeleon, Hershey

title: SaPagsapitngIkatlo
creator: Habac, Jaime Parpan Jr.
castcrew: Idanan, Ice; Fadul, Marxie Maolen; Medrano, Jeddalyn; Sales, Rommel; San Antonio, Veronica

title: Tweet
description:
Abstract
 
 Borlaza, V. J. (Director), (2009). Tweet [Motion Picture]. Philippines: University of the Philippines Diliman.
 
 "I want to create a movie for my family, a movie they can watch." That was my mantra and inspiration from the conception and throughout the production of this short film. The viewing comfort of my parents, the main source of funding for this thesis, is of primary consideration. This short film ought to approximate a typical family oriented movie funny, light, cheerful, and non exorcist of unpleasant emotions and experiences. To engage my family further, my mother especially, I chose a story that they can relate to. This semi-autobiographical short film follows Sophia as she tries to sort out her life by going back to her hometown after being separated with her husband. During this transition stage, her son Kiko, apart from his father and his usual environment, will develop or meet an imaginary friend. Sophia eventually feels that the exorcism of her son's imaginary friend is the last ingredient to her imagined comeback to life. The story revolves around Sophia's funny and futile attempts to get rid of her son's imaginary friend, Tweaky. I chose to treat this short comedy with the aesthetics of Camp. Excessiveness, exaggeration, interspersed with occasional bad taste is seen from the production design, wardrobe, musical score, and acting.
creator: Borlaza, Victor John Emmanuel A.
castcrew: Castro, Marcella; Palomares, sasha; Araneta, Miko; Conela, Christopher; Figuerres, Judd

title: Agatha
description:
Abstract
 
 Encelan, Sheiglyn P. (2009) Agatha. Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of
 the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 
 Most people spend the rest of their lives trying to fit in, trying to find a place where they belong. It is in human nature to desire for acceptance in all forms - in his society included. This is the story of Agatha, a retiring teacher in the barrio, who seeks the acceptance of her peers. She finds this opportunity by ushering her student to win the local Math Quiz Bee, thus Carlo's triumph is her triumph. When an old student, Ramil, presents himself at her doorstep with the Math Quiz Bee's test paper, Agatha finds herself making a once-in-a-lifetime decision.
 
 Will she cheat and share Carlo's triumph vicariously? Or will she do the right thing and retire with nothing attached to her name?
subject: TEACHERS IN FILMS, EDUCATION IN FILMS
creator: Encelan, Sheiglyn P.
castcrew: Encelan, Pamela Gina; Encelan, Roel; Claravall, Hermann

title: Onse
description:
Abstract
 
 Onse is a story of a man who dreadfully wants to retire from being a hired gunman.
 It is an insightful sociological commentary on power, obligation and deception. The framework I used for the narrative followed the analysis of Marxian notion of exploitation. The film posits that it is not the consciousness that defines the belong; it is the circumstances involving the material regulations and material needs.

creator: Vardeleon, Hershey
castcrew: Palomares, Sasha; Araneta, Miko; Serrano, Patti; Santos, Kevin Lee; Castro, Marella Jem; Canela, Christopher Juergen

title: By Manuel Morales
description:
Abstract
 The film is about a young struggling designer who dreams of becoming famous. The designer meets an assistant who works in the city’s biggest fashion magazine. Consequently, the magazine is launching a project where it seeks to discover young designers with new aesthetics. The young designer is chosen as a candidate and becomes a big hit.
 Inside the fashion circle, he meets a stylist who teaches him ins and outs of fashion. The young designer easily adapts to his new environment and becomes snobbish and arrogant. In the end, he is invited to a party where he is officially baptized as a new member to fashion circle.

Abstract
 This thesis discusses conscience. It is apparent that people’s decisions are affected by conscience. This thesis will explore the consciousness and sub-consciousness of a woman who has been put in a situation wherein she has to come out of her comfort zone to save a man’s life.

title: Brgy. Maligaya
description:
Abstract
 Ang tesis na ito ay isang matalinhagang pagtulisa sa kung paano hinuhubog ng isang lipunan, sa pamamagitan ng mga paniniwalang nakagisnan at mga tradisyon, ang kaligayahan ng isang bata. Ipinakikita rin sa pelikulang ito kung paanong ang mga paniniwala at tradisyon na ito ay unti-unting pumapasok sa kamalayan ng bawat bata at isang banda ay nagdidikta kung paano dapat mamuhay, sa kanyang paglaki, kung nais niyang maging maligaya.
 Ang pelikulang ito ay isang ring makahulugang krititismo sa mga kwentong pambata, particular na ang mga fairy tales na literature at pelikula. Sa pagbabasa ng filmmaker ang mga aklat tungkol sa kanila, kanyang natunghayan ang kanilang kasaysayan na nagbukas ang malaking pinto sakabuluhan ng tesis na ito. Pinag-aralan niya rin ang ilang mga fairy tales na isinulat ng magkapatid na Wilhelm at Jacob Grimm at ni Hans Christian Anderson at nalaman, sa tulong pa ring iba pang mg aklat,ang mga konbensyon ng mga fairy tales na literature.
 Akin ring pinag-aralan ang mga animation na gawa ni Walt Disney at ibang pang mga fairy tales sa pelikula upang malaman ang mga kobensyon ng mga fairy tales sa naturang midyum.
 Pinag-aralan niya rin ang mga ito at nakabuo ng isang fairy tale na nagtatanong tungkol sa katotohanan ng “ happily ever after’’ at kung paano ba talaga ito nakukuha o dapat mukha ng isang tao base sa lipunang kanyang kinagagalawan.
subject: SOCIETY IN FILMS, THRILLERS
creator: Seeckts, Shenn Irerick Guillermo
castcrew: Seeckts, Frederick; Sales, Rommel

title: Keep your Tickets for Inspection
description:
Abstract
 
 Keep Your Tickets For Inspection is premised on the normative licensing by class markers," objects/behavior identified with class/lifestyle which influences how people are treated in modern societies. "One against all," people constantly indulge in an act of surveillance of these signs of class in deciding how they would treat the other.
 
 In presenting bus passengers as a metaphor for the silent majority, the film critiques the passivity in everyday life. It experiments on whether frustration, with the push and pull of anxiety brought about by the aggressive dialogue of signs and passivity in the desire for acceptance, can surface a consciousness of the political.
subject: TRANSPORT IN FILMS
creator: Castro, Marella Jem
castcrew: Alarilla, Adrian Ellis; Fernandez, Maria Carmen; Alparce, Sierra Cecilia; Penafiel, Melissa, Fukushima, Erika; Serrano, Patricia

title: Ang Alamatng Kulay
description:
Abstract
 Mallari, M.R.G(2009). Ang Alamat ng Kulay, Student Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication. 
  
 Long ago, the earth only had three colors inhabited by three clans representing each. War broke when the three clans sought to have the crystal as the source of color and immoral life. Adeya , from blue can, and Sinukuan, from the red, caught passion for each other, even though love between two of the different kind is forbidden. They went into hiding when the crystal broke into pieces and the earth lost its colors. Meanwhile, Adeya bore three children of disparate colors. Silab was almost re, Agwe, was almost blue but the last one, Bunyan favored by their parents so the elder two became jelous. Silab and Agwe killed Bunyan and through Bunyan’s death, the three colors multiplied back and restored the colors of the earth.
 The film entitled Ang Alamat ng Kulay attempts to have explore the structure of the children’s story in the form of Philippine folklore.
 It seeks to explain where the different colors in the world came from while it shows value of self-sacrifice despite flaws one encounters. The genre of animation was used to further promote these values.
subject: COLOUR
creator: Mallari, Marie Rivelle Garcia
castcrew: Rodrigo, Mikai; Ladignon, Ella Mae; Lualhjati, Paolo; Mallari, Rivelle; Lindaya, Paolo; Magsaysay, Raffy

title: Hindi Sumusuntok sa Hangin
description:
Abstract 
 Alcala, A. I. B. (2009). Hindi Sumusuntok sa Hangin (Not Beating the Air), Student Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 This thesis revolves around the analogy between the sport of boxing and the struggles that ordinary people face in their lives. Because boxing is such a popular sport in the Philippines, it serves a fitting metaphoric device in illustrating analogy. Differently people face different kinds of problems which entail different yet nonetheless legitimate ways of overcoming them. This illustrated metaphorically in the film through different boxing styles and other boxing elements. This was done through the story deals with three protagonists: a doctor, a hospital patient and a nurse. The story is set before, during and after the Manny Pacquiao-Oscar de la Hoya match, through boxing parallelisms, the character’s respective conflicts and obstacles are presented.
subject: GAMBLERS IN FILMS, BOXING IN FILMS
creator: Alcala, Ana Iris Braga
castcrew: Soliongco, Caloy; Espia, Hannah; Escueta, Ina; Garcia, Mara; Alcala, Angela

title: Limang Libo
description:
Abstract
 Idanan, A.J. R. (2009). Limang Libo, Student Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication. 
 
 “Limang Libo” is a film about two people who live separate lives and are unaware of each other’s existence. The two characters are Susan and Manuel, both her husband and son, and is bound to her debts. Manuel on the other hand, is a scavenger at a city dump site who lives with his eight-month pregnant wife. Their paths cross due to an unfavorable accidents risking the lives of Manuel’s wife and unborn child. He takes his family to Susan’s house, letting her take charge of the whole situation. Faced with unfortunate circumstances, both Susan and Manuel will be forced to act against their instincts.
 The film relays an important message that the people, when challenged by situations brought to them by society, are sometimes forced to act against their natural behavior in order to survive. These decisions, which tend to be done rashly and without contemplation, greatly affects not only their own lives but also the ones of those around them.
subject: SOCIETY IN FILMS, CRIME IN FILMS
creator: Idanan, Aiza Jane Rimas
castcrew: Lupac, Maita Lirra; Espia, Hannah; Habac, Jaime Jr.; Idanan, Norman

creator: Padilla, Abijoyce
castcrew: Garcia, Richmond, Garcia, Sol, Yap, Jumar; Manatad, Carlo Francisco; Naguit, Nani

title: Prodigy
description:
Abstract
 Prodigy is a 20-minute narrative film on digital video using P2 technology. It tells the story about father and son who will reconcile their differences through music. 
 This films integrates sound as the motivation of the story. Music serves as the main dialogue of film. The use of jazz helps the characters release their emotions and express themselves. Through music, they find harmony. 
 It is stated in Baudrillard's Theory of Hyperreality, "the moment modernity exploded upon us is the moment of liberation in every sphere; and the only thing we can do after liberation has been achieved is to simulate that liberation." In this film, the almost endless production of memories has brought liberation to the person who owns these memories.
subject: MUSICIANS IN FILMS
creator: Pornela, Crystal
castcrew: Cabigon, Chad; Ramos, Franne Cheska; Clamor, Tey; Perez, Andice Marie; Manaatad, Carlo Francisco; Araneta, Miko

title: Alam mo Yung Ganun (Alam mo 'yung ganun? sa TUKLAS)
description:
Abstract
 
 
 
 Go. G.T (2009) Alam mo yung ganon?. Unpublished Undergraduate thesis University of the Philippine College of Mass Communication 
 
 “Alam mo yung ganon?” aside from being the title of this film is a question that is thrown around a lot. It is a question that simplify ask for understanding. It is used when in need of someone relate to one’s situation. It is seeking for assurance that one is not alone. The through is, most often that not people are not looking for answer to their problems but someone just to listen and tell them that they know what one is talking about. And this, simplify is the intention of the film.
 
  The film is about specific group of young and privilege Filipinos who are all still trying to figure out what to do to their lives after college. It basically fallow a day of a life of Mara as she goes to her classes and hung out with their friends. It is more than anything a youth film. It appears to be a personal film but if is more of the story of my friends than it is mine 
 
 Sigfried Kracauer’s Theory of realism and jean twenge’s generation of me are the main theories’ are used in the framework.
creator: Go, Bebe
castcrew: Garcia, Richmond, Garcia, Sol, Roxas, Gerry;

title: Numbalik diwa ang Lumalabong Gunitang Lumang Ako
description:
Abstract
 Numbalikdiwa literally means ”return of the subconscious’’. The translation of the Filipino word diwa inherently comes from the series of discussions presented by Virgilio Enriquez in From Colonial to Liberation Psychology(1994). The proponent express great interest in the study and observation of people and varied process of thinking. Consequently, having read an array of essays and journals on the contentious study of the human subconscious, it is deemed generally interesting and provocative to experiment on the visualization of such. On the level of personal interpretation and the general limitations of this proposal, Numbalikdiwa ought to mean “the generic consciousness revisualized.’’ 
 The film is the proponent’s sixteen-minute attempt to visualize the Filipino subconscious through an emblem of a lethargic old man losing hope in the brink of demise. He finds false compassion from the different personas with three different intentions one entertains, one empathize. What is left of his capacity to save his own subconscious (diwa) is hindered by a personal battle to realize who or what to believe.
 Guiding this film are Virgilio Enriquez’s theory of Liberation Psychology and Jacques Derrida’s Deconstruction.
subject: AGED IN FILMS
creator: Garcia, Richmond Barlam
castcrew: Clamor, Tey; Navarrete ; Diszon; Rabadam;

title: SantaKrusan
description:
Abstract
 Santacruzan is a festivity to commemorate Queen Helena’s Search for the Holy Cross. It is a mixture of beauty pageant and procession but is different from the former two. The film Santacruzan reenacts the journey of woman from pain and loss towards happiness and conviction. The ’santacruzan’ itself is a journey of a young woman wearing a beautiful gown with their incomparable display of grace and confidence.
 The thesis entitled Santacruzan is a 20-minutes experimental film shot on digital video using P2 technology. The film illustrates a night in a life of a single mother who works a club dancer to make a living for her, her mother and her young daughter. The film explores the ability of a woman in the process of becoming- complex, enigmatic and beautiful. She with pain loss, yet committed to dealing with such hardship in life with courage, love and grace.
subject: PROSTITUTES IN FILMS
creator: Yap, Jumar

title: Be Fabulous: the Guide to a“Better” new you

creator: Fernandez, Joan Rose C.
castcrew: Sales, Rommel; Alcazaren, Whammy; Baban, Jesse Rey Logrosa

title: Bottled Star
description:
Abstract
 
 Bottled Star takes as its subject the concept and practice of escapism in the modern age. Escapism is the practice of distancing yourself from the immediate present and seeking refuge in something else. Today, it has evolved to take on a multitude of forms and methods. We are offered so many ways to seek refuge from our problem through television, film, alcohol, and, most notoriously, the Internet. All of these can combine to form a more potent blindfold than religion. However, the relief these things
 Provide can keep people functional. And in fact fuel today’s capitalist society like a cycle of addiction and purchase.
 
  Indulging in escapism always comes with the possible effect of becoming out of touch with reality, and out of touch with other people. This thesis film portrays people surrounding themselves with commodified dreams and items that they do not really need, and these things blind them from seeing what the world has offer. Today’s economic and system readily provides us with multiple avenues of illusory happiness continuous stream until we become dependent upon them for what we believe to be our peace of mind.
