  This documentary looks at the life of Jose “ Peping “ Regarde” , an old photographer who has seen it all in Luneta’s fields. He took odd jobs, but he did not stick to it and see it as something he will do for long. Until he found photography.
  He may not have wanted to be a photographer at first, but time and opportunities that came his way necessitated him to embrace his profession. He was able to provide for his family and send his children to school with he was able to do. More than 40 years on the job and he is still at it.
  Technology presented challenges to his work and ability to provide for his family but he embraced all of it. He had no choice. Instead of being bagged down, he used technology to earn more. It also gave him an identity.
  Our fast paced life makes it easy for us to miss those in the periphery, Those who could not keep up will definitely get left behind, As technology gets us more connected, we are faced with the problem of being out of touch. Out of touch from those around us, Out of touch from our own realities. This makes it is so easy to be alienated from society and oneself.
  
  The filmmaker relates with the subject. From doing work that is not what he studied for to re-inventing himself over and over to fit a decision or the opportunities that presented itself. From being a film major to working in broadcasting to doing corporate based productions, one thing is definite. The need to change and adapt will always be a part of life.
  
  Following Karl Marx’s thoughts on work and alienation, Buhay Hanapbuhay aims to document the story and struggles of someone who, like his work, is also in danger of becoming obsolete.
creator: Ocampo, Jewel Ranier
castcrew: Regarde, Jose

title: Caption this version 2.0
description:
Abstract
 
 Matias, P.M.A (2018) Caption This. Version 2.0 Unpublished Undergraduate 
 Thesis University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication
 
  Caption This is about Leah, a fresh college graduate who tries to look for genuine love and acceptance in the online world of Instagram. Wanting this, she joints an online competition where she needs to gain a number of followers. She posts good pictures where she shows that she has an amazing life when in reality, she has a lonely one. 
  With this generation of technology, people forget to live in the moment and even over-dressing their lives to be accepted. The filmmaker made to the “reality” not aligned with what’s shown in social media animation because most of the time, what people show in social media is not what they really are in real life. Somehow, people forgets to live in their real lives because they are too busy living in the online world.
  The film follows the Social Rank theory in showing how an individual always look after their ranking in society or in a particular group.
creator: Matias, Patricia
castcrew: Alarcon, Angela

title: Breastmilk is the best for babies
description: Jasi traces her family background through Lola's bad memory and Lolo's unbelievablestories.
creator: Clavecilla, Aya
castcrew: Clavecilla, Ferdinand; Clavecilla, Thelma; Cayetano, Grey

title: Ang lumunod sa atin
description: Rom comes home, after years of living away. Back home, a monstrous creature starts following him as he starts to unravel long-forgotten secrets from his fast.
creator: Regalario, Sonia
castcrew: Evangelio, Steven Paul; Gacutan, Josef

title: Halawod
description:
Abstract
 
  This film challenges the viewer’s nations of modernity and development contextualized in the indigenous people’s experience. The filmmaker wanted to challenge conventional representations of indigenous people ‘s culture in mainstream media that is oftentimes devoid of history and conflict. The filmmaker creates a virtual space for dialogue between them and with the audience.
creator: Tejero, Anna Katrina Velez
castcrew: Tejero, Agustin; Tejero, Moonyen; Olarte, Jon; Tejero, Anna Katrina Velez

title: Kontrolado ni Girly ang buhay n'ya
description:
Abstract
 
 Kontrolado Ni Girly Ang Buhay N’ya tells a slice of Girly’s life as an unemployed gay teen living below poverty line with his passive mother and an abusive stepfather. He later finds his mother being sexually harassed by her partner. Girly’s life changes when the abuses around him repeats to himself and he has nothing left to do but to control his life forward.
  
  Kontrolado Ni Girly Ang Buhay N’ya is a slice of a teenage gay oppressed by his environment’s economic and sexist factors, in which the characters in the film try to survive and live on to what the realities of their lives give. The framework used in writing the screenplay is Queer Feminism on Patriarchy, Capitalism and Sexual Violence as these reflect on the film’s women and queer characters as the primary mobilizers of progression and how both genders share such power to fight against their common oppressors. The film used humanism and its universal language of humanity translated in writing, cinematography, editing , and design in the film’s form for its message to transverse division of individually and power and to suture the audience’s consciousness in a non-passive familiar transcendence into the film’s humanism and reality.
creator: Baldoza, Gilb
castcrew: Mayuga, Martin; Tribdino, Deriq

title: Pisara
description: Lisa, a young passionate teacher, prepares her requirements for her job interview in Manila when Nika, a quiet but curious transfer student from Surigao, shakes her focus. With language and culture as barriers between confusion and enlightenment, Pisara will test Lisa's perspective, ideals, and dreams as an educator and as a citizen of her nation as she learns more and more about Nika. This film, through the lens of multicultural education theory, aims to shed light on the lack of inclusivity surrounding the education system of our postcolonial multicultural country. It also tries to address the collective ignorance educational institutions impose on students and tries to present a discussion on how we as a society could replace this ignorance with open arms and unhindered understanding of our rich and evolving culture.
creator: Centeno, Pate
castcrew: Ponce, Cristina; Espadero, Trisha

title: Candlemaker
description:
Abstract
 
  The film tells the story of Tiago, a widower candlemaker who goes about his life making candles. It is a story of his days alone and just going about his life and how he interacts with people. Candlemaker is a portrait of loneliness that forces one to go on with life.
  
  This thesis explores how the Social Exchange Theory function for a man who is faced with loss and lowliness. The film aims to make the viewer feel how the main character is lonely yet must still go through life and interact, not to mention participate in society. It aims to make the viewer see that even if we prefer to be isolated in dealing with our own problems, we are pulled into reality by worldly things like money to survive. Social Exchange Theory states that people engage to gather rewards or results. The higher results with the least amount of cost would be the most likely option for people. This film presents that is normal in society for a main character to go through such needs.
creator: Babate, Alyson
castcrew: Zapanta, Silvana; Villaflores, Che

title: Baguio address no. 10 (cast)
description:
Abstract
 
 Baguio Address No. 10 is an experimental film revolving primarily around the filmmaker ‘s family’s experiences of constantly having to move from one house to another. The work connects past home videos, old photographs, recorded conversations, and mobile phone videos in an attempt to dream of a future home through cinema. 
  
  The work is an inquiry into video media and how it serves as a vessel of remembering and forgetting. Studies on video practices by Sean cubit and Marita Sturken primarily guide the work. By documenting the present through an outdated medium Hi-8 it address the materiality of video media , to which we attach our nostalgia. Furthemore, it seeks to move personality history, memory, and dreams forward through the digital form.
creator: Aquino, Mervine
castcrew: Aquino, Arnulfo; Aquino, Marilyn; Arciga, Miguel; Aquino, Mervine

title: Mga puwang sa dayami
description:
Abstract
 
 Mga puwang sa Dayami tells the story of Laay, a hen who gives birth to a single egg. Amidst the war-ravage state of her village, she decides to protect the egg at all costs. However, the egg still gets stolen by enemy ninjas during a stealthy attack. Laay decides to travel the vast land to look for her egg. She reaches the neighbor farm and discover a giant factory processing and packing thousands of egg. Shocked, she tries hard to remember what her egg looks like. 
  The film aims to get its message across by using Karl Marx’s theory and critique of capitalism. The Marxist Theory emphasizes that the capitalist stage of society consists of two main social classes: the bourgeoisie who own the means of production and the proletariat who are sole contributors of labor power to the production process. Capitalism, therefore, is ruthless. It breeds a system where people are treated like animals –commodities which can be so easily disposed or replaced. It gives birth to imperialist countries whose capital translates into political power. Political and military power are used to repress and terrorize other countries and exhaust capital goods from them. Capitalism itself dehumanizes to sustain the war it is waging against the most marginalized: peasants, workers, women and children.
creator: Melegrito, Claudee Mae

title: Bangkang papel
description: Binibigyang-kritisismo ng tesis na ito ang kakapatupad lang na Tax Reformation for Acceleration and Inclusion (TRAIN) Law, sa pamamagitan ng pagpapakita ng epekto nito sa mga marhinalisadong sektor sa ating lipunan, gaya ng mga mangingisda. Nais ipahayag ng tesis na ito na ang agong reporma sa pagbubuwis ay naging dagdag pasanin lamang sa mga mangingisda dahil itinaas nito ang presyo ng gasolina at ng mga bilihin. Ang pahayag na ito ay sinikap itawid sa pamamagitan ng kuwento ng isang batang babaeng napiling kinatawan ng kanilang paaralan sa isang Math contest. Problema nila ng kaniyang nanay na mangingisda ang registration fee dahil marami pang mga gastusin at tumataas ang presyo ng mga bilihin. Susubukang isolve ng anak ang mga math problems sa kanilang buhay pero malalaman niyang hindi madaling isolve ang mga mabibigat na math problems ng buhay, kagaya ng kawalan ng katarungang panlipunan. Ang implikasyon ng nasabing reporma sa mga mangingisda ay isang manipestasyon ng ipinanukalang Conflict Theory in Max Weber. Nakasaad dito na ang lipunan ay patuloy na nakararanas ng kahirapan dahil kinokontrol ng mga mayayaman at makakapangyarihan ang lipunan upang mapanatili ang kasalukuyang kawalan ng katarungan, sa pamamagitan ng pagpapatupad ng mga batas na mangangalaga sa kanilang mga interes. (Trubek. 1972).
creator: Musa, Maria Gracella F.
castcrew: Musa, Mabel F.; Musa, Marcelo R.; Mariano, Emman B.

title: Diwasanag
description:
Abstract
 
 Maquilan, A.K. (2018). Diwasanag. Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis. University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 
 Diwasanag follows the journey of a lake spirit who falls in love with the moon but realizes that it is only attracted to the sea spirit. The lake spirit risks its own environment and identity in an attempt to copy what the sea spirit does and looks. The lake spirit sprints to its wilted environ just as when the moon spirit finally notices its efforts.
 
 The film revolves around self-love that leans on the concept of Normative Social Influence, a type of social influence that leads to conformity. It states how beings reshape themselves in order to conform on what is ideal and likable to their love interest.
creator: Maquilan, Adrian Karl Obenque
castcrew: Balbuena, Bianca; Maquilan, Nilo Vega; Dagsaan, Mio; Nartea, Anton

title: In their shoes
description: A high school sneakerhead gets noticed by a popular social media influencer. He struggles in choosing between using his newly found popularity and platform for his own personal gain or using it to show the state of our society.
creator: Garcia, Miguel
castcrew: Garcia, Victor; Garcia, Jocelyn; Navarro, EJ

title: Hala ka, puputulin 'yang titi mo !
description:
Abstract
 Magat, R. DC. (2018). Hala ka, puputulin 'yang titi mo!, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
  Ang pelikulang Hala ka, puputulin 'yang titi mo! Ay nagnanais ilahad ang naratibo ng mga batang kinikilala ang sarili sa mga panahong nabubuo pa lamang ang kanilang pagkatuto sa mundo. Susundan dito ang kwento ni Jan-Jan, sampung taon at nasa ikalimang baitang sa mababang paaralan na nabuo ang pagkahilig sa paglalaro ng luksong goma (o chinese garter) kasama ang dalawang babaeng kaklase. Nais ilahad ng pelikula ang pagtataka ng isang batang walang nakikitang mali, mula sa kanyang mga kilos, galaw, interes, hanggang sa kanyang sariling pagkakakilanlan ngunit sa kabila nito'y may mga pagdududa ang mga tao sa paligid niya. Layon ng pelikulang ipakita na kasabay ng pagkatuto sa sistema ng mundo, sa murang edad ay may kapasidad magdesisyon ang mga kabataan para sa sarili at may kakayahan sa pagbaka upang maging tanggap sa lipunan. Kakabit nito ang pag-ugat sa macho-pyudal na kultura at pagpabasag sa represibong sistema, mga institusyong patuloy na nagpapalaganap ng kaisipang hindi pantay ang karapatan ng lahat ng kasarian na nakaukit na kaisipan ng karamihan. Ang balangkas ng edukasyon sa bansa na sa murang edad pa lamang ay ikinikintal na sa kaisipan ang nararapat na kilos ng bawat kasarian. Ang relihiyon na nagdidikta at kinukundena ang pagiging iba, labas sa heterosekswalidad na siya lamang na tanggap ng simbahan. Laganap ito hanggang sa kasalukuyan kaya't ngayon, higit na kailanman ay dapat na matigil ang sistemang ito sa kasalukuyang balangkas ng lipunan.
creator: Rafael Magat
castcrew: Encarnacion, Issa; Magat, Rafael

title: Anamamana
description:
Abstract
 
 This film centers on two women, a mother and a daughter, with two different personalities and how being stick together at home further strains their relationship. The story goes through their daily routine at home, the two find themselves obligated to live and work together. As they both face the dreariness of their situation they eventually appear together in a hopeful dream that shows how harmony between two different people is a possibility.
  
  In expressing the feelings and the struggle of acceptance and understanding of each other’s differences and similarities, the filmmaker was inspired and guided by the psychological concept of polarized or binary thinking wherein everything is either all you fault or not at all, right or wrong, black or white, not being able to find a middle ground Semiotics was used in order to emphasize the disparity of the characters most evidently through color. Additionally, the film also aims to recognize women struggles particularly those that come from domesticated female role expectations.
creator: Dela Paz, Christine
castcrew: Dela Paz, Daisy; Dela Paz, Willie; Mendoza, Kaila; De Guzman, Marvinne

title: Department of heavenly entrance
description:
Abstract
 
 Si, R. J. M. (2019). Department of Heavenly Entrance, Unpublished Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication
 
 The film is a satirical take on man's propensity to "miss the point" in the context of Christian Salvation.
 
 Using Kafka's writing style as a framework, the film envisions the afterlife as a needlessly long bureaucracy that actualizes how religious people view their salvation as attainable through an arbitrary amount of ritual practices instead of Grace as it is taught in Catholic theology. Salvation becomes unattainable when pursued on its own. But because they are convinced that it is the way to the goal, these men pursue its futility anyway without stopping to think or learn that what they know is lacking, misinformed, or completely wrong to begin with.
creator: Si, Jerome
castcrew: Mina, Chloe

title: Sa kabilang panig ng mga alon
description:
Abstract
 
 This thesis intends to capture the unique ways we are enamored by the opportunities offered in foreign in foreign countries through the perspective of a young person who is about to embark on her journey and portray the ambivalent feelings that come with it. 
  Having two sisters who immediately become part of the exported workforce (Overseas Filipino Workers) prompted the filmmaker to tell a story about what leaving home means, what family means, and how everything only comes focus with the thought of separation.
  The filmmaker wishes to show the different ways we are connected by our dreams of far-away lands. “Sa Kabilang Panig ng Mga Alon“ examines our constant search for greener pasture and considers the possibility that the grass could be greener right here where family is.
  Using Kimberle Crenshaw’s theory of Intersectionality, gender and class issues are the core of the film’s social commentary as seen through each of the characters’ stories. Intersectionality is a prism for understanding the ways multiple forms of inequalities compound themselves to create handles about feminism, ethnicity, or any social justice advocacy structures we have. Women from the lower class, especially those from the regions of the Philippines find themselves relying on working overseas or worse, being in feigned relationships with foreigners. The narrow possibilities available to people from the provinces leave them no choice but to face the disintegration of their family unit by migrating to Metro Manila as the country’s center of economic activity, or abroad where salaries are much sustainable. This brings a national sentiment of how it is like to live in the continuing phenomenon of Filipino diaspora.
 
 A. SYNOPSIS
 The film is about Jelly, a young woman who struggle to find the money needed for her to work abroad. She tries different ways of completing the placement fee by pawning a gifted necklace and selling her beloved guitar. Along the way, she tells the story of women in her life that motivates her to find better opportunities. Her ill mother Lucia, a former OFW who raised her alone and, her aunt Grace who relies on her American boyfriend. When she gets enough money, her uncle calls to say that her mother was rushed to the hospital, compelling her to stay here and decline the caregiver job in China to take care of her own mother instead.
creator: Tordillo, Chaela
castcrew: Tordillo, Michelle Izzy; Tordillo, Allysa Franz; Sardual, Nathaneil; Cayco

title: Recollection
description: A woman is reminded of her childhood dreams when her troubled teenage niece spends the night. Using the elements of Psychoanalysis and magical Realism, the film shows the struggle between personal desires and external pressures like family and social expectations. Steph in an independent working adult in a routinary life. This constancy is shaken when Ana, her niece and an aspiring musician struggling against the expectations of her parents, stays at Steph's place for a few days, Ana gradually triggers memories from Steph's childhood, a time in which her dreams of painting and pursuing art were very much alive. It dawns on her that she has become just like those who repressed her dreams as a child. As more memories surface, she gives in to her itching desire to paint. In the end, Steph decides to persuade her brother to let Ana keep her goals. She then starts painting again.
creator: Cruz, Patricia Camille

title: Patulinan
description: Patulinan is a sports drama film about bestfriends and softball teammates, Loli and Maya, as they await their college entrance results. Problem arise when the more self-assured and egotistic friend, Maya, has only been waitlisted, while insecure yet more athletically talented Loli finds out tha she made the cut through varsity tryouts.
creator: Penales, Angela

title: Isa sa sanlibong alitaptap
description: Francis and Talia go through their journey of bereavement in their own separate ways only to find each other and realize that maybe that's what they needed all along.
creator: Perez, Maria Carmela

title: Wanderlost
description:
Abstract
 As a strong advocate of OPM, the filmmaker wanted this film to encourage its audience to support the local scene more as it is thriving more than ever. At the same time as a huge K-pop fan also, she also wanted others appreciate the genre since she personally believe that music bring people together culturally. The film uses Theodore Adorno and Max Horkheimer’s culture industry wherein a certain culture has been industrialized to fit standards of the masses.
 
  The film is entitled ”wanderLOST “ as a word play with “wanderlust”, which means” a strong logging for wandering “ (Merriam-Webster) and “lost” as to show the feeling of being lost in one’s journey in life. The film features a musician (Kin), wandering about what happened in this past memories that he has gotten himself at a point of being lost. Max not only represent something new in Kin’s life, but also represents hope and refreshment – in the desire to be found in the end. The filmmaker wants its audience to feel hopeful and found at in whatever confusion they are in, the way she was able to find herself throughout the production of his film.
creator: Ramirez, Kath
castcrew: Fontanilla, Evangeline C.; Ramirez, Kath; Arnonobal, Miggy

title: Balakid
description:
Abstract
 
 Gallardo, Tara Grace M. (2019), Balakid. Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 
 A man finds a bowl of ice cream in front of his door. Letting itself in, the man finds himself having a mutual relationship with the bowl of ice cream. The ice cream then morphs into a rope, which starts sexually abusing the man. The man finds himself being helpless and controlled by the rope as it keeps on sexually abusing him. He then finds it in himself to fight against the abuse and control of the rope, setting himself free and putting the rope into a state that would never be able to harm and abuse him again.
 
 The film is inspired by Norman Mclaren's film Neighbors in terms of its method as a pixilation animation film. The character in the film is bounded by hegemonic masculinity as he struggles with the abuse, making him have a "masculinity crisis". He then resolves to repression and behavioral coping as his defense mechanism. With the lack of dialogue, the cinematographic apparatus is employed to help the audience relate to it and make them see that this is the "objective reality". The film's aim is to create a discourse and awareness among the viewers on male victims of sexual abuse.
creator: Gallardo, Tara
castcrew: Gallardo, Wenresti; Galllardo, Gladys; Gallardo, Tara

title: Mauuna na ako
description:
Abstract
 
 
  Binigyanang-kristisismo ng tesis na itong papel ng rehilyon sa patuloy na pananatili ng mga patrilyarkal na pagpapahalaga sa loob ng tahanan. Mabisang instrumento ang rehilyon sa paghulma ng kamalayang isang individual. Ang imahe ng pagkababaeng itinuturo sa Baptist na rehilyon, kung san nararapat na siya’y manahimik, sumunod at magpaubaya ayon sa itinututo sa loob ng simbahan, ang ginagamit na batayan ng mga kababaihang Baptist sa kung papaano nil dapat na ilugar ang kanilang sarili. Ngunit huwad ang imahe ng pagkababe na ito. Nais ipahayag ng tesis na ito na hawk ng babae ang kapangyarihan ng magpasya para sa kanyang sarili.
  Ang tesis na ito ay isang pagsisiwasat. Bilang isang midyum ng pamamahayag, taglay ng pelikula ang kapangyarihan magsiwasat ng mga isyung panlipunan. Naging instrumento ang pelikula upang isalay say ang sitwasyon ng mga kababaihang Baptist, na bagama’t naninirahan na sa kasalukuyang panahon ay nakukulong pa rin sa mga makalumang nosyon ng pagkababae. Sa pamamagitan ng pagsundo sa kwento ni Faith, ang pelikula ay iminungkahing gamiting instrument ang edukasyon at pag kakaisa upang makamit ng kababaihan ang gender emancipation o pagpapalaya ng kasarian.
creator: Carandang, Tin
castcrew: Carandang, Carlos; Carandang, Aida; Duran, Gina; Carandang

title: Katahimikan, 2500
description: As Jun and Mia are going to an uncertain place, Mia hopes that people in their destination truly exist. They both believe that they have different worlds based on their various decisions. [Supplied by Quad]
creator: Belardo, Mark
castcrew: Castro; Raul; Garcia; Myn; Lapeña; Cuevas. Bullet Arleen; Kohle, Fritz

title: Puke ng ina
description:
Abstract
 
 Dani, a maladjusted prepubescent, suddenly bleeds from her crotch during one unsuspecting night. When her menarche coincides with her father getting fired from work, news of mysterious creatures abducting and killing people in the city, and her mother in pain and bleeding, she takes matters into her own hands. She applies first aid on her mother’s bleeding crotch, and gets transported into her mother’s womb, where she faces the mysterious creatures from the news that she recognizes not just as foreign beats, but also as figures from her own home.
 
 The film uses Materialist Feminist and Social Surrealist Frame work to negotiable the three-fold hostility women experience in the spaces, both in public and private spaces as we grow up in extremely patriarchal society and in terms of internalized violence and self-repression in the unconscious. Using these frameworks, we also link the material basis of oppression of women, and even of men, rooted in a surreal reality of a state that oppresses and feminizes everyone.
creator: Galang, Drestel
castcrew: Gonzales, Alice; Domingo, Thea

title: Tanikala ng kalayaan
description:
Abstract
  Tanikala ng Kalayaan is a trip down memory lane. The film shows how something that may be holding us down might also be the thing that can give us freedom.
  
  The framework followed the concept of escapism. Peter Vorderer states that “In its core, escapism means that most people have, due to unsatisfying life circumstances, again and again cause to “leave” the reality in which they live in a cognitive and emotional way, “ (1996). This is manifested in the film through Kyle’s dreams. Also supported by the Oneiric film studies, Ricciotto Canudo and Jean Epstein, early film theorist, argued that a dreamlike quality is present in films. In psychoanalytic thought, dreams are of particular importance. It is describe as “ the royal road to the unconscious “by Freud. This film theory establishes a link between what is factual and what is merely a manifestation of an illusion. It encourages filmmaker to reconstruct what is factual and make it abide to their underlying dreams.
creator: Espino, Monique
castcrew: Espino, Monique; Espino, Noel; Espino, Jinky

title: Bistek
description:
Abstract
 
 Mariano, E.D.B. (2019). Bistek. Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis. University of The Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 
 Bistek follows Marko, an 24 year old copywriter who is mourning the loss of his only family left, his mother, Grace. Marko, filled with regret, tries to save enough money in order to give his mother Grace a final resting place. Marko works at a small advertising company where he is a writer. There, he is forced to succumb to his Boss' demands and requests and his artistic freedom is not respected. Fearful that he might lose his only source of income, Marko tries and tries to meet his Boss' demands.
 
 Grounded on the theory of semiotics, Bistek uses multiple semiotic devices planted throughout the film to convey the Protagonist's emotions and help in showing and shaping the story. The film is also relies on the use of colors to help intensify the mood and tension felt throughout the film. The film also uses flashback scenes to convey Marko's regrets in life and why he would do anything and everything in order to give Grace, a proper burial and a final resting place.
creator: Mariano, Emmanuel
castcrew: Mariano, Denver; Mariano, Gegeth; Encarnacion, Issa

title: Recycle
description:
Abstract
 
 This film tells the story of a 12 year old girl struggling to understand the changes in her body when she discovers her father’s morbid fascination. It begins with 12 year old Merion forced into the role of the carer of the household after the disappearance of her mother. She finds blood in her underwear and tries to secretly find out what it means. Upon discovering her secret, her father recognizes her as a full-fledged woman and he begins to collect fresh body parts to construct for his daughter the perpect body-just as he bad done for her mother.
 
  The film is a visual representation of what it is to be a woman in a society where men make the decisions over women’s bodies. It utilizes Lara Mulvey’s theory of the male gaze where women are seen as more objects, and Raewyn Connell’s concept of hegemonic masculinity-considered to be more powerful and dominant over more feminine masculinities is an unreachable fantasy.
creator: Fernandez, Abby

title: Yes ma'am!
description:
Abstract
 The film centers around Myra, a woman in her late20s, who has decided to continue studying through the alternative Learning System (ALS) program. Dealing with the pressure of having the same educational attainment as her daughter, a condescending mother-in-law who ashamed of her going back to studying, and having a hard time keeping up to her lessons, Myra finds herself struggling on whether she should continue doing ALS or not. In the bridge of breaking down and finally giving up everything, Myra gains realizations from the root of her pressure, her daughter, that changes her perspective of herself.
  
  Since before, education has been a large basis of where a person stands in the social hierarchy. The society treats education as one of the most valuable things that could affect a person’s development that almost everything is dictated by a person’s educational attainment. The filmmaker wants to stress through the film how education has been more of a privilege rather than a right and how it affects people who can only do so much with their circumstances. Education should be something that is free and subsidized by the government, as it is a right-something everyone deserves.
creator: Solano, Mitzi Dvand D.
castcrew: Lado, Fe Delos; Solano, Dang; Solano, Melvin; Navarro, Edelwin Joy

title: Banal na pag-iisa
description:
Abstract
 
 Banal na pag-iisa revolves on a mass wedding of same-sex couples in juxtaposition with the life of two participating lesbian couples, tackling how their marriage deepens their commitment to each other in the midst of social judgments and economic struggles that tries to keep them and their family apart.
 
  This documentary film challenges the tradition notion that marriage can only happen between a cis male, a man who was assigned male at birth, and a cis female, a woman assigned female at birth, by showing that there are numerous queer people who undergo the rite of holy union to declare their love and commitment for each other even in the absence of state recognition. Using queer theory as a framework, this film aims to denaturalize the institution of marriage in the Philippines and advocate for the recognition of same-sex marriage for them to have the same benefits that heteresexual married couples enjoy. In the film, parts of the ceremony are juxtaposed with the lives of the two participating lesbian couples to provide a discourse on issue of acceptance of their sexuality and gender, lack of better employment in the country that forces them to be away with their family, and the lack of legal support that recognizes the validity of their marriage.
creator: Cristobal, Christine
castcrew:
Cristobal, Jas; Capalad, Edwin; Navarro, EJ; Mosot, Ron Nigel; 
Arciga, Maps; Cristobal, Christine Nicole

title: Sa pag-alala ng nawawala't nariyan (cast)
description: The discourse on the current state of film archiving in the Philippines unfold.
creator: Carlos, Eireen
castcrew: Carlos, Rene; Carlos, Fe; Manzano, Kimy; Navarro, EJ; Carlos, Eireen

title: Hakdawan
description:
Abstract
 
 Leocadio, J.B. (2019). hakdawan, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 
 Itinatampok ng hakdawan ang Tagamasid bilang tambal na pasibo at aktibong ahente ng akto ng pagkonsumo ng mga imahe. Pugpog ng mga imaheng sinasalamin ang kanyang sarili at ang mga pangyayari sa kanyang paligid, tutukuyin ng Tagamasid kung paano siya aahon mula sa dagat ng mga imaheng humihila sa kanya pababa.
creator: Leocadio, James
castcrew: N/A

title: Hangganan (Limit)
description:
Abstract
 The film centers on people who are apolitical and apathetic towards the various societal issues that continue to mar the country. It’s the story of two apolitical individuals whose perspectives are changed when they simultaneously experience the killings instigated by the government. One of its main objectives is to show that having no stand is also a political choice and that it is essentially the same as making the wrong stand. It also aims to shed light on the different reasons why this people choose to be passive in the midst of all the atrocities occurring around them. Thoughts the principles of Third Cinema, the film will provide social commentary on the oppressed and appeals to the Filipino people to become more vocal about societal issues.
creator: Alcayaga, Jvee Christian
castcrew: Alcayaga, Crispina; Alcayaga, Joanne; Alcayaga, Mel; Navarro, EJ

title: Happy monthsary
description:
Abstract
 
  Villena, I. C. (2015). Examining the "5-5-5" Arrangement in Contractualization: A Study on the Repeated Hiring Practices of Firms in Selected Industries. Institue for Labor Studies.
 
  This film is about how a contractual worker named Marko has its love life intertwined with his endo jobs. The story starts with his breakup with his current girlfriend at his job because his contract with the company has ended. Every time his job ends, his relationships also end. So, he will again find a new job where he will meet a girl named Emy, and together they will fight for the worker's security of tenure. 
 This film is about and against endo or the vicious cycle of contractualization. The filmmsker used the concept of love as a metaphor for endo labor. The use and abuse of contractualization has only benefited the capitalists and those in authority that makes the workers, who are greatly disadvantaged by this, have no voice and no control over their wages, work benefits unsecured and uncertain.
creator: Acuna, Jade
castcrew: Acuña, Victorio G. Jr.; Acuña, Jade

title: Eros
description: The film revolves around the life of Eros, who became an AIDS/HIV advocate after living with Human Deficiency Virus for 10 years. His voice speaks for the community of people living with AIDS/HIV to seek treatment and to not give up on life. Thus, this documentary aims to inform the public about their situation to at least, break the stigma that people living with HIV were experiencing, hoping that this health issue could be a normal discourse in the country. It explores Erving Goffman's, a sociologist, Theory of Stigmatization, that those who were stigmatized should see oneself as "normal" in order to deal with normal people. Lastly, this medium aims to influence other people with the same condition to fight the stigma they are facing from the society while at the same time, overcoming the virus that destroys the immune system of their bodies.
creator: Policarpio, Mariel Lyka

title: Terminal
description: A man befriends a young vendor but their friendship is cut short when a lamp post hits the boy. Faced with death and stripped all of his comforts, the man becomes conscious of his situation and starts to grow more irritable  and impatient as he observes everyone around him is indifferent and stationary. Having had enough of his situation, the man gets off the line and makes a way to the unknown.
creator: Lustanas, Karen

title: Bukas mata
description: Ten-year old Gabriel starts to hear ghosts at night. With the arrival of a new pet bird and Tita Sabel from the U.S., he tries to find connections between his ability and his mother, who was recently imprisoned doing social work in the remote farmlands. As he tries to find out more about his inherited third eye, he begins to realize that the search for the truth is much more complicated and winding that he thought and not as grounded in the supernatural as it seems.
creator: Lacsamana, Bronte

title: Ibang daan pauwi
description: Ibang Daan Pauwi tells the story of Mejos, a construction worker in Manila in his late 20s, who needed to come home to his ill mother in Cavite. Along the way, he loses his wallet and was also rejected to take a ride home despite this pleads and negotiations. He then resolves to walk his way home. After walking under the scorching sun, he meets Angel, a prostitute who offers to help him look for money as long as he takes her with him. Night comes and they both face unexpected situations as they walk in the streets of Manila. The film is a critique to the city of Manila under the current political context. Following Italian Neorealism, the film presents the illusion the city creates that no matter how familiar people are with it, Manila is still a disorienting place.
creator: Laguda, Stelle

title: Dagami Daytoy
description:
Abstract
 Isang maikling dokumentaryo ang DAGAMI DAYTOY (THIS IS OUR LAND) tungkol sa paglaban ng Didipio, isang komunidad sa Nueva Vizcaya na apekto ng malaking dayuhang minahan.
  Sa loob ng limang taon ng pakikipamuhay at tuloy-tuloy sa pagkuha ng foodtage, sinubukan ng pelikula na mailarawan ang malagim na kondisyon ng mamamayan bilang epekto ng pagpasok ng dayuhang minahan: ang away sa pagitan ng isang tribu, ang nabuong distansya sa pagitan ng mga miyembro ng komunidad, ang eksploitasyon ng mga rekurso. at ang unting unti kamatayan ng katutubong kultura dahil sa dayuhang pwersa. BInibigyan diin nito ang pagiging buhay na halimbawa ng dayalektikong materyalismo sa danas ng paglaban ng mga katutubo at ng kalikasan.
  
  Sa ganitong sitwasyon, inoobserbahan ng pelikula at binibigyan rin ng espasyo at tinig and komunidad kung pano nila tutunggaliin ang estratehiya at taktika gamit ang esktraligal na pakikibaka sa mahabang panahon ng laban para ipagtanggol ang lupang ninuno.
creator: Abao, Noni

title: Kiping Lukban
description:
Abstract
 Salumbides, Mary Jo Candice B. (2019) Kiping Lukban. Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication, Quezon City.
 
  Celebrated in Lucban, Quezon, the Pahiyas Festival is an annual feast in thanksgiving to Saint Isidore the Laborer for the year’s bountiful harvest. Lucbanins adorn their houses with fresh produce and kiping, a colorful leaf-like rice delicacy. Months before the Pahiyas Festival, kiping-makers work in preparation for the May festivities and Lucbanin farmers harvest their palay and crops just in time for making kiping and decorating houses. However, as tourists flood the narrow streets of Lucban on the day of the festival, they seem to be more engrossed in the event as a spectacle rather than celebrating with the people, especially the farmers, for another year of good harvest. 
 
  This short documentary explores the effects of the festival’s commercialization since its development for tourism purposes which was spearheaded by the Marcos Administration in the 70s. While tourist enjoy the wonderful scenery, the invisible struggle of the people behind the scenes are forgotten. For the farmers, the day of the Pahiyas Festival is just like any other day in their cyclical life. It slowly ceases to be a celebration for and by farmers – it is now a highly – visited and publicized tourist attraction due to non – cultural and non-religious interest that have been successfully embedded in the festivities.
creator: Salumbides, Mary Jo Candice B.

title: Pauwi ka na ba?
description:
Abstract
 
 Tomas, A.G.M. (2019). Pauwi Ka Na Ba?, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 
 Pauwi Ka Na Ba? is an animated film telling the story of a young woman and her journey on taking up the armed struggle in the countryside. The film examines her internal conflicts as she attempts to reconcile her dreams to serve the people with ensuring the wellbeing of her family. In her decision-making, she is reminded of her arguments with her sister when announced her decision to leave the city, and conversations with her mother beckoning her to stay home.
 
 The film utilizes the form of animation in order to re-imagine the memories and experiences of the subject of the film. Furthermore, to create the spaces to generate and manipulate meanings through this form.
creator: Tomas, Angelica Grace M.

title: Bit player
creator: Gozum, Christopher Q.
castcrew: Regala, Joel; Lim, Joseph; Pira, Claudire; Caton, Troy; Almaldez, John

title: Uwi
creator: Roces, Ma. Theresa Blanca
castcrew: Tayag, Preciouse; Panuncial,  Genisis; Lopez, Lorna; Magisa, Robert, Daniel; Pirote, Gigi

title: Sa among agwat
description: Two brothers spend the remaining time together as they face their impending separation.
creator: Senoc, Don
castcrew: Senoc, Cid Madula; Lim, Kelvin John; Lados, Zafra, Sheila

title: Ajax
description: Former lovers Ace and Jack come face to face with each other in a poker game with long-time friends. They game turns into an intimate strip poker game when the former lovers are the players left. Both determined to be unbeatable at the game, Ace and Jack go as far as they can in a game of probabilities and expectations.
creator: Bordado, Marielle

title: Bao (year)
description: My thesis is a short film that tackles the essence of motherhood, its myths and ideology on the point of view of the daughter. It focuses on how theses myths have the power to effect women's lives, in this case, her grandmother's, her mother's, and her life. The short film was shot in 16mm format and runs for 16 minutes. The short film shows ideas about mothers who have been portrayed in extremes : the 'good mother' - women who are nurturant, kind and selfless as well as bad mothers who are vain, selfish, neglectful and abusive. This film proves that these myths do not accurately reflect the realities of motherhood but they powerfully affect the experience of motherhood. Mothers may try to conform to the myths, to follow the advice given to them. When myths bear no resemblance to reality, mother feel anxiety, guilt, and sometimes despair, which in turn powerfully affect their experience of motherhood
creator: Encarnacion, Nina Sharon
castcrew: Perez, Sarah; Tubid, Bing; Sta. Ana, Ailene; Reyes, Dianne Mary Cel;  Mahinay, Gladys Anne

title: Bawi (UPFI best thesis AY 2010-2011)
description: In Filipino, "bawi" means recovery or revenge. The director used this as an overarching theme in carrying out his story and in his execution. The film deals with the social reality of rampant yet largely unresolved child abductions combined with organ theft in the periphery of the Nation Capital Region. The film also seeks to explore recovery and revenge in terms of the narrative wherein a single mother recovers her child and inflicts her revenge through a final fight based on three Filipino Oral Epics where the heroines are not only live givers but life takes as well. The film recognizes the success of realist films in recent memory as films that represent the realities of today's modern society but it also seeks to infuse to new life into the traditional Filipino Oral Epics by presenting these stories in a manner that would be attractive to today's film audience
creator: De Rivera, Jose Antonio
castcrew: Llantero-Biatco, Rad Dylan; Antonio, Tess; Roco, Bembol

title: Larawan
creator: Avecilla, Audielyn C.
castcrew: Avecilla, Audielyn; Avecilla, Ayen; Avenido, Melinda; Castro, Noel

title: Urban apocalypse
creator: Vera, Joel
castcrew: Andrews, Timothy

title: Akyat pababa
creator: Inductivo, Carla Bianca
castcrew: Rosario, Jay Del; Rizo, Lorenzo

title: Isang bagong taon
creator: Tugade, Rachell Grace D.
castcrew: Reyes, Albert; Serrano, Edwin; Tobias, Jose Jr.; Bayani, Angeli;

title: Riles
creator: Bacong, Jeanie
castcrew: Abraham, Shahein; Linda, Anita; Fagela, Israfel; Mapa, Jao; Mauricio, Maureen; Ondevilla, Mark; Roco, Bembo; Santos, Joseph David

title: Track 2
description: This film centers on finding one's identity and the assurance of security in one's identity. It is drawn from the psychoanalytical theory of Jacques Lacan in which he suggests the Imaginary Order wherein an individual does not realize that s/he is his/her own person and not just a part of the world. Lacan's psychoanalytical theory suggests the Mirror stage as the point when one realizes its own individuality and identity, which is what the main character experienced by the end of the film. The film follows Tinig, a musician aspiring fame to continue her late father's one-hit music career. She struggles with rejection from music labels, with the pressure of continuing her father's dream, and with the pressure of seeing her friends more successful in her dream. The climax is reached when, in the midst of all the pressures, she hears her father's hit song and is reminded of his unconditional love for her in spite of her failures. This assurance helps her to continue making music, not for fame, but as an expression of herself no matter what the world expects of her. It aims to be an encouragement to the artists and creators who feel like they aren't good enough for the field that they are in. The film aims to be a reminder for individuals to continue on with their passions despite disappointments and failures because it is possible to encounter unconditional acceptance that will welcome both successes and failures with open arms
creator: Del Valle, Vivien
castcrew: Phy, Pamela Paige; Tumaliuan, Josiah; Garcia, Richard;  Merced, Angeline

title: Gibran
description: Cultural boundaries are constructs of society that guides man to the right and acceptable action from what is not. But in the context of a society where different cultures meet, conflict of truths exist that affect every facet of human life. This Thesis is a documentary drama film titled "Gibran" that narrates the life of a Muslim child in a predominantly Christian community, taking into account the conflicts encountered in his everyday interactions and his adjustments to both the demands of society and beliefs and practices taught by his family. The film, set in Maharlika Village, Taguig, Bicutan, reflects the personal experience of the author in coping with the pressures of coexistence of two different difficulties affecting his way of life which is heavily influenced by his faith. The film starts with the act of "Sughbu" followed by the second episode of the noon-day muezzin call for "Dohor". Coming home from his friend's house, Gibran joins his mother for the 3:00 "Ashar" prayer and the next episode displays his interactions with his family as the time for Maghrib nears. The film culminates with the "Aisah" prayer, with Gibran performing the act of ablution
creator: Abubakar, Ayesah Uy
castcrew: Misah, Gibran; Kipli, Julwadi; Ebillo, Elnora; Enriquez, Paolo

title: Ang aking ama at ang musika (year, crew)
description: This documentary film is about Mr. Enrique Barcelo, a well-known Flutist in the Philippines. His daughter narrates his achievements and silent good deeds towards his students. She also shows how the people that surround their family think about the industry of music. [supplied by Quad]
creator: Barcelo, Ma. Luningning & Jennifer Jehan Cui Jumadiao
castcrew: Barcelo, Enrique

title: Katong gabii (Katong gabii (That night) sa TUKLAS)
description: Katong Gabii is a film that documents the lives of two survivors of the Roxas night market bombing in Davao City on September 2, 2016. It centers on Fatima, a vendor at the market whose intestines were shattered by a shrapnel, and Dennis, a truck driver whose wife and son died while getting a massage. The documentary follows these two survivors a year after the tragedy. The film examines the differences of the subjects' experiences - how they cope from the traumatic experience, how it is to be a Muslim and a Christian, and their social positions as a man and woman recovering from a life-altering incident. Katong Gabii highlights how strong Filipino faith is; it also emphasizes the alarming and terrifying effects of war on terror on innocent civilians, and that it does not choose its targets. The documentary uses the Cinema Verite style and it anchors on Psychoanalysis and Marxist Feminist theories to dissect the loss of Dennis, and the hardships of Fatima as a single mother in the lower working class.
creator: Bolatag, Jeremy Luke
castcrew: Manalo, Fatima; Larida, Dennis

title: Pagbabalik tanaw
description: A young man is made to reflect on his past life decisions when he visits an old friend's art exhibit. Juan accepts the invitation despite the fear of his past haunting him. In the exhibit, he is confronted by what he could have been by seeing the success of Mel, evidenced by his paintings, admirers and by meeting Mel's longtime girlfriend Mika. The film tackles how a person's economic state and familial expectations influence a person's future and career path. In the case of the film, Juan's economic state wasn't as stable as Mel's adding to the reasons why the former chose to pursue engineering instead of joining Mel and Mika to study art in France. Juan's visit to Mel's exhibit is the exploration of the thought of "what could have been", whether or not it is right for a person to choose a path dictated by family. This film aims to say that there is no wrong choice, it is you that decides whether or not the choice made should be regretted. Engineering and painting were chosen because of their significance to me, and because they are two different mediums. Engineering is a common course chosen because of promising career income, while painting is the less popular choice because art doesn't always sell. Impressionism was used in this film because first, unlike the very linear work of drafting in engineering, this style is very painterly (distinguished by its use of color, texture, and strokes more than lines). Impressionism also focuses on the fleeting yet important moments of life, something that Mel has gotten accustomed to given that many things have changed after he decided to study in France, giving him many fleeting events that he would want to capture in his paintings.
creator: Tulod, Kristopher Jan V.
castcrew: Macalintal, Dexter; Matos, Kiko; Reyes, Genevieve; Millario, Kendra

title: Toksik
description: Toksik tells the story of Carlo, the only living person left inside Megamanila. Carlo is infected, having touched his mother right before she dies from the virus, but it does not kill him. As part od his daily routine, he listens to his music collection, watches his favorite romantic film, and looks for food in abandoned supermarkets. One day, a woman named Ligaya from outside the city stumbles upon his home looking for food. Being the first person he sees in years, Carlo tries to befriend her. Toksik is a film about the struggle to accept reality - no matter how grim, painful, or uncertain it may be. Using psychoanalysis and media dependency theory, the film deals with themes of escapism, loneliness, longing for acceptance, and fantasy vs. reality, and explores being trapped in a cycle of escapism and fantasy - and ultimately breaking free.
creator: Ante, Alberto Gian Carlo P.
castcrew: Ante, Jennifer; Ante, Bobby; Ang, Tiffanie; Del Rosario, Clare

title: Hello, Mina
description:
Abstract
 Hello Mina? is a short psychological horror about Mina and her struggles as she tries to figure out her thoughts of violence towards herself and her imaginary friend. Mina is at a constant state of confusion in rationalizing her own thoughts as she tiptoes towards trying to seek help from her family.
 
  The film explores the struggles of people with mental health issues calling out for help specially in an environment that dismisses possible mental health issues as drama or just a phase to endure. The Cognitive Triad theory by Aaron Beck demonstrates the cycle of negative thoughts that people with depression undergoes. He illustrates that negative thoughts can led to automatic thoughts of negativity. Thus, there is a need for that person to break the cycle. However, breaking the Stigma theory by Ervin Goffman, considers mental health issues as one of the possible stigmas in the society that may in turn cause those suffering from mental health disorders to stigmatize themselves, making it harder for them to seek out help.
creator: Mendoza, Vanette
castcrew: Mendoza, Vanni; Mendoza, Janette; Encarnacion, Issa

title: Islabodan (Free men) (year na lang kulang)
description: Islabodan is a story about a lone, apathetic plastic bottle collector, Caloy, who gets caught in the middle of two warring gangs of plastic bottle collectors like him which changes his life forever. The anarchist school of thought infused with libertarian and communist disciplines are the key ingredients of the film as this is the vision of the filmmaker for a better world. Alongside a pinch of existentialist thought for the thorough brewing of what is to come as the ultimate realization and clarity of a goal which is to eliminate the elitist way of running things. However, should the goal be achieved, do we stop? Or should the goal be not achieved, do we also stop? We are left with a challenge to carry on and push onward with hope in our hands
creator: Tarobal, Juan Carlo
castcrew: Tarobal, Mau; Tarobal, Zeny; Mosot, Ron Nigel

title: Serum
description: Serum tells the cyclical story of Namo, a law enforcer in a dystopian society that bans the existence of the homosexuals. In his society, there exists a serum that allegedly normalizes these homosexuals. Despite him being a closet gay and while hiding his gay lover inside their abode, he continues to be the law enforcer who will soon face a bitter reality not only for himself, but also for those like him. The film is about the unending battle between religion and sexuality. This battle always rages towards the cycle of arguments, doubts, contemplation and compromise. It is mainly associated with the intrapersonal perspective, molded by a governing institution, such as the church. Yet, at the same time, it captures the inevitable decision that social norm will always break its way into the ideals of the closet - usually forcing the closet open with the person inside brought to unknown. The film takes the form of a cyclical narrative, with the experimentation on sound and editing in order to achieve a phenomenological play of the senses,in order to disrupt the audience from the film, the feel the filmmaker's motive towards the overall theme.
creator: Mansos, Gert Rino
castcrew: Mansos, Gil; Mansos, Agnes; Mansos, Irlina; Mendoza, Lou; Sanchez, Ana Lou

title: Man in the cinema house
description: A Ma is imprisoned in a movie theater for killing Jose Rizal. He attempts to escape. Man in the Cinema House is a tempo-spatial critique on the cinematic institution, its conventions and exploitation that have been normalized. It is a love letter to cinema, but at the same time, a protest to the very institution that guides its creation. The Man is the ghost of cinema as much as the spectator becomes a "ghost" when watching a film in the movie theater. The film challenges the boundaries of cinema both in the metaphorical sense and the meta-physical method. The angry movie Man escapes, declaring that he is no more a ghost, but free of the restrictions of cinema. He recognizes that he has become a Self.
creator: Mercado, Bernard Jay
castcrew: Mercado, Bernard; Mercado, Nilda; Singson, Patricia; Aruta, Edge

title: Mayo 15
description: Si Kulay, pangalawa sa tatlong magkakapatid, ay naiwang mag-isa sa kanilang bahay sa kanyang ika-labingtatlong kaarawan. Habang naghihintay sa pag-uwi ng kanyang pamilya, ihahanda niya ang sarili sa pagkadalaga at tuluyan nang iiwan ang kabataan. Ngunit sa hindi inaasahang pangyayari, makakarating siya sa tatlong mundo na makakatulong sa kanya upang mas maunawaan ang proseso ng paglaki at pag-angkop. Gumamit ang pelikula ng apat na teorya: Sikolohikal na Teorya ng Personal Pag-unlad na iniuugnay ang edad ng isang tao sa kanyang maturidad, Teorya ng Estado ng Identidad, mas malalim na pag-aaral ng naunang teorya, Sikolohiyang Filipino, na iniangkop ang unang dalawang teorya sa mas lokal na teksto, at Semiotic sa pelikula, na iniuugnay ang mise-en-scene ng pelikula sa layunin nito. Ang pelikula ay nakapokus sa pagdedesisyon ng isang bata kung tuluyan na ba niyang lilisanin ang kamusmusan upang tuluyan nang harapin ang pagkadalaga. Dahil sa ekspektasyon ng lipunan, na nauuwi sa middle child syndrome (depende sa laki ng pamilya at order ng magkakapatid), at mas higit pa ay peer pressure, ang bida ay maiipit sa ideya ng pagsunod sa agos ng lipunan o pananatili sa mundong kinasanayan, isang desisyon na palagay ng direktor ay hinarap ng lahat, sa paghahangad na maging mas maayos na kapwa-tao.
creator: Manalo, Carla Marie Juguilon
castcrew: Yambao, Ariana; Banaag, Kaye; Menale, Carla

title: Sa dulo ng bahaghari
description:
Abstract
 Sa Dulo ng Bahaghari (In the Ends of a Rainbow) is a 19-minute film which is divide into three parts; the past, entitled Ang Babaylan focuses on a Babaylan during the pre-colonial era of the Philippines. The present, Teacher Chris, focuses on a lesbian teacher that is oppressed by her school. The future, Patataas, focuses on a higher being removing gender on potatoes. The film was also a silent film relying heavily on its scores and on its visuals.
 
  The filmmaker also focuses on showing the displacement of the socio-political status of the queer Filipino after colonialism thought presenting symbolisms supported by semiotics. By using symbolisms such as land, water, genitals, hair, etc., the filmmaker have presented a way to maintain the Filipino identity even after, colonialism and neocolonialism
creator: Alsol, Aaron
castcrew: Alsol, Meldy and Egay; Alsol, Aaron; Morilla, Rocky;  Alsol, Andrew

title: The Last Puzzle Piece
description:
Abstract
 The last puzzle piece unfolds a family’s process of acceptance and way of understanding their loved one who is diagnosed with autism. In a family of three—a single mother with two sons, the younger having autism---, both the mother and the older son help the younger son adjust to a world of normalcy. As the younger son grows, their perspective of what is good for a person with autism out to be bad.
 
  In the experimental-animation film, the filmmaker uses Semiotics which aims to use animation to interpret the character’s (with autism) feelings towards a given situation (e, g. behavior or reaction of one person with autism to fluorescent lights). The filmmaker chose an adult to represent the transition of age—from toddler to teen to adult – to show a consistent sense of innocence of a person with autism. The use of original musical scores will be the language of communication as the filmmaker express the idea of how music and/or sound can make a person’s thoughts and/or emotion understood even without words. It also uses Cohen, Leslie and Firth’s Theory of Mind, to show how people with autism have difficulty in understanding people’s thoughts, emotions, and attitude but also debunks the notion of them lacking empathy.
creator: Pangilinan, Janell
